#Diarrhea, epigastric discomfort and poor oral intake: Improved 
since admission. Poor intake in the past 2 days prior to 
admission. No vomiting or nausea. Had ___ loose stools since 
admission. No fevers at home and remained afebrile throughout 
hospital course. No other associated infectious symptoms 
currently.
-Cdiff negative; other stool cultures PND at discharge 
-UA with 6WBC; urine culture < 10, 000; Repeat UA/Urine CX PND 
at discharge 

#Hypokalemia: Now normalized, was 3.0 prior to admission. Her 
hypokalemia was noted in the setting of decreased oral intake 
and GI loss (diarrhea). Received K+ repletions at home. 

#Shortness of breath on exertion and lightheadedness: Improved 
since admission. Etiology likely related to profound anemia and 
decreased oral intake. Received 1U
prbcs at clinic prior to admission and received 1U in-house for 
hemoglobin of 7. No evidence of hypoxia or fever to suggest an 
acute pulmonary process. Hemoglobin 9.4 at discharge. 

#MDS: Noted for rapid progression of pancytopenia, particularly 
anemia. Bone marrow biopsy with dysplasia of all cell lines with 
noted cytogenetic abnormalities concerning for treatment related 
MDS. ___ made to treat with Dacogen with
plan to move towards allogeneic transplant. Neutrophils and 
platelets recovered prior to starting ___ cycle. Counts now low 
following treatment as expected although platelet appear to be 
recovering. She is currently ___ ___ C3 of Dacogen. 
-transfuse for platelets < 20,000 (54 at discharge) and HGB < 
7.5 (9.4 at discharge).
-C4 Dacogen due on ___ has appointment with Dr. ___ bone marrow biopsy after 4 cycles and hopefully move 
forward with allogeneic transplant. Has unrelated donor. 
-Ciprofloxacin and Fluconazole have been on hold; restarted 
ciprofloxacin on admission as ___ < 500. 
-Bactrim discontinued as CD4 count > 200
-Will monitor IGG level; give IVIG for IGG less than 300 or 
infections as IVIG can affect counts. Last IVIG ___ = 762

#Lymphoma/CLL/Disease Status: Has been in remission with last CT 
scan in ___ without evidence of lymphoma/adenopathy. Has 
history of CLL as well; no evidence of this on BM biopsy by 
report. 

#Lower back pain: None on admission. No longer using narcotics 
or oxycontin. Continues on Gabapentin taper 
(900mgQAM--800mgQAfternoon--700mgQPM) per patient report.

#Headache: History of headaches; reported an episode on ___ 
but has had extensive w/u in the past that were reassuring. 
Denies headache since ___. Will not pursue further evaluation 
or treatment unless acute worsening or focal deficits

#Right leg DVT: Holding Xarelto 20 mg daily as platelet count < 
75,000. Has IVC filter in place.

Dear ___:

You were admitted because you were having decreased appetite, 
fatigue and diarrhea for several days at home. You received red 
blood cell transfusion and intravenous fluids with improvements

#Diarrhea, epigastric discomfort and poor oral intake: Improved 
since admission. Poor intake in the past 2 days prior to 
admission. No vomiting or nausea. Had ___ loose stools since 
admission. No fevers at home and remained afebrile throughout 
hospital course. No other associated infectious symptoms 
currently.
-Cdiff negative; other stool cultures PND at discharge 
-UA with 6WBC; urine culture < 10, 000; Repeat UA/Urine CX PND 
at discharge 

#Hypokalemia: Now normalized, was 3.0 prior to admission. Her 
hypokalemia was noted in the setting of decreased oral intake 
and GI loss (diarrhea). Received K+ repletions at home. 

#Shortness of breath on exertion and lightheadedness: Improved 
since admission. Etiology likely related to profound anemia and 
decreased oral intake. Received 1U
prbcs at clinic prior to admission and received 1U in-house for 
hemoglobin of 7. No evidence of hypoxia or fever to suggest an 
acute pulmonary process. Hemoglobin 9.4 at discharge. 

#MDS: Noted for rapid progression of pancytopenia, particularly 
anemia. Bone marrow biopsy with dysplasia of all cell lines with 
noted cytogenetic abnormalities concerning for treatment related 
MDS. ___ made to treat with Dacogen with
plan to move towards allogeneic transplant. Neutrophils and 
platelets recovered prior to starting ___ cycle. Counts now low 
following treatment as expected although platelet appear to be 
recovering. She is currently ___ ___ C3 of Dacogen. 
-transfuse for platelets < 20,000 (54 at discharge) and HGB < 
7.5 (9.4 at discharge).
-C4 Dacogen due on ___ has appointment with Dr. ___ bone marrow biopsy after 4 cycles and hopefully move 
forward with allogeneic transplant. Has unrelated donor. 
-Ciprofloxacin and Fluconazole have been on hold; restarted 
ciprofloxacin on admission as ___ < 500. 
-Bactrim discontinued as CD4 count > 200
-Will monitor IGG level; give IVIG for IGG less than 300 or 
infections as IVIG can affect counts. Last IVIG ___ = 762

#Lymphoma/CLL/Disease Status: Has been in remission with last CT 
scan in ___ without evidence of lymphoma/adenopathy. Has 
history of CLL as well; no evidence of this on BM biopsy by 
report. 

#Lower back pain: None on admission. No longer using narcotics 
or oxycontin. Continues on Gabapentin taper 
(900mgQAM--800mgQAfternoon--700mgQPM) per patient report.

#Headache: History of headaches; reported an episode on ___ 
but has had extensive w/u in the past that were reassuring. 
Denies headache since ___. Will not pursue further evaluation 
or treatment unless acute worsening or focal deficits

#Right leg DVT: Holding Xarelto 20 mg daily as platelet count < 
75,000. Has IVC filter in place.

#Depression: Continue home venlafaxine

Dear ___:

You were admitted because you were having decreased appetite, 
fatigue and diarrhea for several days at home. You received red 
blood cell transfusion and intravenous fluids with improvements 
in your symptoms. We think that these symptoms are likely side 
effects of your chemotherapy as further workup did not show a

#Diarrhea, epigastric discomfort and poor oral intake: Improved 
since admission. Poor intake in the past 2 days prior to

admission. No fevers at home and remained afebrile throughout 
hospital course. No other associated infectious symptoms 
currently.

-UA with 6WBC; urine culture < 10, 000; Repeat UA/Urine CX PND 
at discharge 

#Hypokalemia: Now normalized, was 3.0 prior to admission. Her 
hypokalemia was noted in the setting of decreased oral intake 
and GI loss (diarrhea). Received K+ repletions at home. 

#Shortness of breath on exertion and lightheadedness: Improved 
since admission. Etiology likely related to profound anemia and 
decreased oral intake. Received 1U
prbcs at clinic prior to admission and received 1U in-house for 
hemoglobin of 7. No evidence of hypoxia or fever to suggest an 
acute pulmonary process. Hemoglobin 9.4 at discharge. 

#MDS: Noted for rapid progression of pancytopenia, particularly 
anemia. Bone marrow biopsy with dysplasia of all cell lines with 
noted cytogenetic abnormalities concerning for treatment related 
MDS. ___ made to treat with Dacogen with
plan to move towards allogeneic transplant. Neutrophils and 
platelets recovered prior to starting ___ cycle. Counts now low 
following treatment as expected although platelet appear to be 
recovering. She is currently ___ ___ C3 of Dacogen.

7.5 (9.4 at discharge).
-C4 Dacogen due on ___ has appointment with Dr. ___ bone marrow biopsy after 4 cycles and hopefully move 
forward with allogeneic transplant. Has unrelated donor.

ciprofloxacin on admission as ___ < 500.

#Diarrhea, epigastric discomfort and poor oral intake: Improved 
since admission. Poor intake in the past 2 days prior to 
admission. No vomiting or nausea. Had ___ loose stools since 
admission. No fevers at home and remained afebrile throughout 
hospital course. No other associated infectious symptoms 
currently.
-Cdiff negative; other stool cultures PND at discharge 
-UA with 6WBC; urine culture < 10, 000; Repeat UA/Urine CX PND 
at discharge 

#Hypokalemia: Now normalized, was 3.0 prior to admission. Her 
hypokalemia was noted in the setting of decreased oral intake 
and GI loss (diarrhea). Received K+ repletions at home. 

#Shortness of breath on exertion and lightheadedness: Improved 
since admission. Etiology likely related to profound anemia and 
decreased oral intake. Received 1U
prbcs at clinic prior to admission and received 1U in-house for 
hemoglobin of 7. No evidence of hypoxia or fever to suggest an 
acute pulmonary process. Hemoglobin 9.4 at discharge. 

#MDS: Noted for rapid progression of pancytopenia, particularly 
anemia. Bone marrow biopsy with dysplasia of all cell lines with 
noted cytogenetic abnormalities concerning for treatment related 
MDS. ___ made to treat with Dacogen with
plan to move towards allogeneic transplant. Neutrophils and 
platelets recovered prior to starting ___ cycle. Counts now low 
following treatment as expected although platelet appear to be 
recovering. She is currently ___ ___ C3 of Dacogen. 
-transfuse for platelets < 20,000 (54 at discharge) and HGB < 
7.5 (9.4 at discharge).
-C4 Dacogen due on ___ has appointment with Dr. ___ bone marrow biopsy after 4 cycles and hopefully move 
forward with allogeneic transplant. Has unrelated donor.

ciprofloxacin on admission as ___ < 500. 
-Bactrim discontinued as CD4 count > 200
-Will monitor IGG level; give IVIG for IGG less than 300 or 
infections as IVIG can affect counts. Last IVIG ___ = 762

#Lymphoma/CLL/Disease Status: Has been in remission with last CT 
scan in ___ without evidence of lymphoma/adenopathy. Has 
history of CLL as well; no evidence of this on BM biopsy by 
report. 

#Lower back pain: None on admission. No longer using narcotics 
or oxycontin. Continues on Gabapentin taper 
(900mgQAM--800mgQAfternoon--700mgQPM) per patient report.

#Headache: History of headaches; reported an episode on ___ 
but has had extensive w/u in the past that were reassuring.

or treatment unless acute worsening or focal deficits

#Right leg DVT: Holding Xarelto 20 mg daily as platelet count <

ASSESSMENT AND PLAN: ___ year old female with history of 
transformed diffuse large B cell lymphoma ___ a curative attempt 
with an AutoSCT with BEAM conditioning in ___ ___s 
IFRT with course complicated by BCNU pneumonitis as well as

C3 of Dacogen) presenting with poor oral intake, diarrhea and 
fatigue

#Diarrhea, epigastric discomfort and poor oral intake: Improved 
since admission. Poor intake in the past 2 days prior to 
admission. No vomiting or nausea. Had ___ loose stools since 
admission. No fevers at home and remained afebrile throughout 
hospital course. No other associated infectious symptoms 
currently.
-Cdiff negative; other stool cultures PND at discharge 
-UA with 6WBC; urine culture < 10, 000; Repeat UA/Urine CX PND 
at discharge 

#Hypokalemia: Now normalized, was 3.0 prior to admission. Her 
hypokalemia was noted in the setting of decreased oral intake 
and GI loss (diarrhea). Received K+ repletions at home. 

#Shortness of breath on exertion and lightheadedness: Improved 
since admission. Etiology likely related to profound anemia and 
decreased oral intake. Received 1U
prbcs at clinic prior to admission and received 1U in-house for 
hemoglobin of 7. No evidence of hypoxia or fever to suggest an 
acute pulmonary process. Hemoglobin 9.4 at discharge. 

#MDS: Noted for rapid progression of pancytopenia, particularly 
anemia. Bone marrow biopsy with dysplasia of all cell lines with 
noted cytogenetic abnormalities concerning for treatment related 
MDS. ___ made to treat with Dacogen with
plan to move towards allogeneic transplant. Neutrophils and 
platelets recovered prior to starting ___ cycle. Counts now low 
following treatment as expected although platelet appear to be 
recovering. She is currently ___ ___ C3 of Dacogen. 
-transfuse for platelets < 20,000 (54 at discharge) and HGB < 
7.5 (9.4 at discharge).
-C4 Dacogen due on ___ has appointment with Dr. ___ bone marrow biopsy after 4 cycles and hopefully move 
forward with allogeneic transplant. Has unrelated donor. 
-Ciprofloxacin and Fluconazole have been on hold; restarted 
ciprofloxacin on admission as ___ < 500. 
-Bactrim discontinued as CD4 count > 200
-Will monitor IGG level; give IVIG for IGG less than 300 or 
infections as IVIG can affect counts. Last IVIG ___ = 762

#Lymphoma/CLL/Disease Status: Has been in remission with last CT 
scan in ___ without evidence of lymphoma/adenopathy. Has 
history of CLL as well; no evidence of this on BM biopsy by 
report. 

#Lower back pain: None on admission. No longer using narcotics 
or oxycontin. Continues on Gabapentin taper 
(900mgQAM--800mgQAfternoon--700mgQPM) per patient report.

#Headache: History of headaches; reported an episode on ___ 
but has had extensive w/u in the past that were reassuring. 
Denies headache since ___. Will not pursue further evaluation 
or treatment unless acute worsening or focal deficits

#Right leg DVT: Holding Xarelto 20 mg daily as platelet count < 
75,000. Has IVC filter in place.

#Depression: Continue home venlafaxine

#Diarrhea, epigastric discomfort and poor oral intake: Improved 
since admission. Poor intake in the past 2 days prior to 
admission. No vomiting or nausea. Had ___ loose stools since 
admission. No fevers at home and remained afebrile throughout 
hospital course. No other associated infectious symptoms 
currently.
-Cdiff negative; other stool cultures PND at discharge 
-UA with 6WBC; urine culture < 10, 000; Repeat UA/Urine CX PND 
at discharge 

#Hypokalemia: Now normalized, was 3.0 prior to admission. Her 
hypokalemia was noted in the setting of decreased oral intake 
and GI loss (diarrhea). Received K+ repletions at home. 

#Shortness of breath on exertion and lightheadedness: Improved 
since admission. Etiology likely related to profound anemia and 
decreased oral intake. Received 1U
prbcs at clinic prior to admission and received 1U in-house for 
hemoglobin of 7. No evidence of hypoxia or fever to suggest an 
acute pulmonary process. Hemoglobin 9.4 at discharge. 

#MDS: Noted for rapid progression of pancytopenia, particularly 
anemia. Bone marrow biopsy with dysplasia of all cell lines with 
noted cytogenetic abnormalities concerning for treatment related 
MDS. ___ made to treat with Dacogen with
plan to move towards allogeneic transplant. Neutrophils and 
platelets recovered prior to starting ___ cycle. Counts now low 
following treatment as expected although platelet appear to be 
recovering. She is currently ___ ___ C3 of Dacogen. 
-transfuse for platelets < 20,000 (54 at discharge) and HGB < 
7.5 (9.4 at discharge).
-C4 Dacogen due on ___ has appointment with Dr. ___ bone marrow biopsy after 4 cycles and hopefully move 
forward with allogeneic transplant. Has unrelated donor. 
-Ciprofloxacin and Fluconazole have been on hold; restarted 
ciprofloxacin on admission as ___ < 500. 
-Bactrim discontinued as CD4 count > 200
-Will monitor IGG level; give IVIG for IGG less than 300 or 
infections as IVIG can affect counts. Last IVIG ___ = 762

#Lymphoma/CLL/Disease Status: Has been in remission with last CT 
scan in ___ without evidence of lymphoma/adenopathy. Has 
history of CLL as well; no evidence of this on BM biopsy by 
report. 

#Lower back pain: None on admission. No longer using narcotics 
or oxycontin. Continues on Gabapentin taper 
(900mgQAM--800mgQAfternoon--700mgQPM) per patient report.

#Headache: History of headaches; reported an episode on ___ 
but has had extensive w/u in the past that were reassuring. 
Denies headache since ___. Will not pursue further evaluation 
or treatment unless acute worsening or focal deficits

#Right leg DVT: Holding Xarelto 20 mg daily as platelet count < 
75,000. Has IVC filter in place.

#Depression: Continue home venlafaxine

documents.text:
History of Present Illness:
___ w/ CVID, h/o FL transformed to DLBCL ___ autoSCT (BEAM prep) 
in ___ in remission from lymphoma then with treatment-related 
MDS ___ 4 cycles of decitabine and planning for transplant, who 
presents with cough and wheezing x2 days. She states that her 
cough is productive with clear sputum with no blood. She denies 
any fever or chills. She has no chest pain, shortness of breath, 
abdominal pain,  diarrhea, or difficulty/pain with urination. She does endorse some nasal congestion and dry throat. She has had issues with bronchitis/pneumonias in the past. Given 
her profound neutropenia, she was referred to the ED for 
possible admission. In the ED, labs were notable for WBC 0.8, ANC 170, H/H 8.0/24.6, 
Plt 27, lactate 1.0, coags wnl. Chem 7: Na 140, K 3.8, Cl 107, CO2 21, BUN 16, Cr 0.8, Glucose 
72. UA, urine and blood cultures were ordered. CXR did not show evidence of pneumonia, however with patient's 
worsening cough and wheezes along with her neutropenia, she was 
treated with empiric antibiotics, including cefepime, 
vancomycin, and azithromycin. She also received albuterol and ipratropium nebs.

IIA

of inflammatory process. Stable right adnexal cyst.

#RSV bronchiolitis
#Cough and wheezing
Patient is neutropenic and has CVID and presented with cough and 
wheezing. She was initially started on cefepime and azithromycin 
for empiric coverage. Patient's respiratory viral screen was 
positive for RSV. She was treated with palvilizumab on ___ and 
ribavirin 600 mg q8h (___). Patient also was treated 
with 4 days of 10 g IVIg (___). She received a 5 day 
course of azithromycin for anti-inflammatory effect. She was 
also continued on cefepime (___), that was transitioned 
to levaquin on ___ for bacterial prophylaxis. She was also 
treated symptomatically with duonebs q6h, mucinex, benzonatate, 
and guaifenesin-codeine at night. Her symptoms improved 
significantly with these measures. She was able to maintain 
O2sat > 95% while ambulating.

was also started on fluconazole during this admission for fungal 
prophylaxis. She was transfused for Hgb < 7 or Plt < 10. She 
received a total of 2U pRBCs and 1U platelets during this 
admission.

autoSCT in ___ now with rapid progression of pancytopenia,

treatment related MDS. ___ Dacogen x4 cycles with persistent

dyspoitic maturation. She underwent MUD Allogeneic transplant

B6 for a projected 9-month course to prevent TB reactivation.

resolved without further intervention and remained stable during 
her subsequent infusions. RUQUS showed patent hepatic 
vasculature and an echogenic liver.

normal after her first infusion of busulfan and ATG. This 
resolved without further intervention and remained stable during

vasculature and an echogenic liver.

difficile from ___ was negative.  Stool frequency slowly 
improved over admission.

appetite slowly improved over admission.  She never had

coffee. She also noted frontal headache in band like 
distribution
around her head. She reports no neck stiffness (other than
baseline related to cervical radiculopathy with radiation down R
arm). Denies changes in vision, numbness, weakness. She has
infrequent, scattered abdominal pain. Denies further diarrhea.
Denies rash. No chest pain, dyspnea, cough, dysuria. 

VS in ER T99.9 94 150/67 18 100% RA . Appears comfortable on the

#Aseptic meningitis
She initially presented with headache fever, nausea and 
vomiting.  She was treated initially with cefepime and acyclovir

aseptic meningitis and no HSV was found in the CSF.  Extensive 
workup for VZV EBV HSV HHV6 adenovirus arbovirus TB
Anaplasma and serum toxoplasmosis was negative.  She was noted 
to have CMV viremia and although this is an unlikely cause of 
meningitis she was treated with ganciclovir.

#CMV viremia
Found to have CMV vl on ___, which persisted. She was treated 
with IV ganciclovir and then transitioned to oral valganciclovir 
prior to discharge.

#Diarrhea
She had mild diarrhea on and off throughout her admission that 
was thought to be likely due to GVHD versus infection.  C. 
difficile from ___ was negative.  Stool frequency slowly 
improved over admission.

#Anorexia 
Waxing and waning appetite that was concerning for acute GVHD.  
A GI consult was considered for upper/lower endoscopy, but her 
appetite slowly improved over admission.  She never had 
dysphasia, odynophagia, or early satiety.

#Dyspnea
She was noted to be short of breath on ___.  She had a drop in 
her oxygen saturation to the high ___ while ambulating this day. 
 ECG was unchanged.  And a CTA was negative.  She had an echo 
performed on ___ which is similar to a prior study on ___ with 
left ventricular systolic dysfunction and hypokinesis of the 
inferior/inferior lateral walls.  Repeat ambulatory sat on the 
day of discharge was within normal limits.

#MDS
___ allogeneic transplant with URD with reduced intensity 
Flu/Bu/ATG conditioning. D0 = ___. Continued prophylaxis 
with Bactrim and Fluconazole. Acyclovir on hold while on 
gancyclovir. Continued cyclosporine.

#Lower extremity edema
Diuresed as needed.

Continued lovenox ___ mg once per day.She has IVC filter in 
place.

#Right lower back pain
Aggravated from moving. Persistent since past few months.

Lumbar spine MRI with and without contrast to evaluate new 
right-sided sciatic pain with no significant changes.

#Asthma
Inhalers were used as needed.

 Some of the

seen.  Given 
that this is a retrievable filter, interventional radiology

be considered for filter removal if it is no longer needed. 
4.  Decrease in size of a now 2.8 x 2.2 cm right adnexal cyst, 
which dates 
back to at least ___.  Consider periodic follow-up with pelvic 
ultrasound to 
document expected continued stability.

IMPRESSION:  
1.  No evidence of pneumonia. 
2.  Enlarged pulmonary artery may be seen in pulmonary arterial 
hypertension. 

UNILAT UP EXT VEINS US LEFT (___):
IMPRESSION:  
No evidence of deep vein thrombosis in the left upper extremity. 


TTE (___):
Conclusions   
 The left atrium is normal in size. No atrial septal defect is 
seen by 2D or color Doppler. Left ventricular wall thicknesses 
and cavity size are normal. There is mild global left 
ventricular hypokinesis. Quantitative (biplane) LVEF = 39 %. 
Right ventricular chamber size and free wall motion are normal. 
The aortic valve leaflets (3) appear structurally normal with 
good leaflet excursion. No masses or vegetations are seen on the 
aortic valve. Trace aortic regurgitation is seen. The mitral 
valve leaflets are structurally normal. There is no mitral valve 
prolapse. No mass or vegetation is seen on the mitral valve. 
Mild (1+) mitral regurgitation is seen. The pulmonary artery 
systolic pressure could not be determined. There is no 
pericardial effusion. 

 IMPRESSION: Normal biventricular cavity sizes with mild global 
left ventricular hypokinesis. Mild mitral regurgitation with 
normal valve morphology. Trace aortic regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology. 

 Compared with the prior report (images not available for 
review) of ___, trace aortic regurgitation is now present 
with similar valve morphology.   

BILAT LOWER EXT VEINS (___):
IMPRESSION: 
1. New deep venous thrombosis involving the left posterior 
tibial and right 
popliteal veins. 
2. No fluid collection in the area of pain in the left lateral 
calf. 

 
Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ immunocompromised female ___ 
alloSCT for secondary MDS admitted for acute change in headaches 
with new, severe symptoms such as nausea and vomiting now with 
fevers to 103 and coagulase-negative gram-positive cocci in 
clusters in blood cultures being treated for S. epidermidis 
bacteremia.

#Headache
CT head performed in the ED ___ was unremarkable but infectious 
etiology remained very high on the
differential given the patient's immunosuppression regimen and 
history of aseptic meningitis during her last admission. She 
also had history of R internal carotid cavernous sinus aneurysm 
with coiling in the past. An MRI head ___ was unremarkable. CMV, 
EBV, HSV, HHV6, adeno, ___, arboviruses, Lyme, 
crypotococcus, and fungal markers were tested and all were 
negative. The patient's headache resolved and she was symptom 
free at time of discharge. 

#S. epidermidis Bacteremia
She had fevers up to 103 on ___ and was started on vancomycin 
and cefepime. The vancomycin was DC'd ___ overnight and she was 
started on linezolid per ID recommendations as she had a history 
of VRE bacteremia in the past and was continued on cefepime. ___ 
blood culture bottles grew S. epidermidis and she was narrowed 
to vancomycin only. A chest x-ray was unremarkable for 
pneumonia. A CT chest ___ revealed no evidence of pneumonia. A 
CT abdomen pelvis ___ did not show any evidence of infection. An 
ultrasound of her port site was without evidence of infection. 
An ultrasound of her LLE ordered for concern of an abscess 
revealed a distal DVT but no fluid collections. A TTE revealed 
normal biventricular cavity sizes with mild global left 
ventricular hypokinesis, mild mitral regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology and trace aortic regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology. A TEE was scheduled but was cancelled as 
patient will need 6 weeks of therapy for treatment of possible 
septic thrombophlebitis. She was continued on Vancomycin until 
___ and was transitioned to Daptomycin on ___ as her 
Vancomycin level fluctuated frequently throughout her 
hospitalization, making dosing of the medication challenging. 
She will need to remain on Daptomycin until ___ to complete 6 
weeks of antibiotic therapy.

#Mechanical Fall
Patient had a mechanical fall during the evening of ___. She 
became incontinent of urine and slipped and fell while trying to 
make it to the bathroom. CT head and C spine were unremarkable. 
X rays of her left wrist revealed no fractures. She was given a 
hard brace based on an OT evaluation. Ecchymosis on head was 
improving at discharge. She will continue to wear the brace 
until symptoms improve.

#MDS ___ Allo MUD SCT
She was conditioned with Flu/Bu/ATG RI and was on cyclosporine 
for immunosuppression. Her home cyclosporine dosage was 75mg QAM 
and 50mg QPM. Initial cyclosporine levels were low and her 
dosage was increased to 100mg BID. Her creatinine increased on 
this dose and she was discharged on dosage of 75mg BID. Her home 
prophylaxis with fluconazole, Bactrim, and valganciclovir was 
initially continued. However, given worsening neutropenia, her 
Bactrim was transitioned to atovaquone and her valganciclovir 
was transitioned to acyclovir. She was scheduled to have a bone 
marrow biopsy with ___ as an outpatient on ___ but this was 
cancelled due to patient's new DVT. She will need to have a bone 
marrow biopsy done as an outpatient.

#DVT
Enoxaparin was held ___ for possible LP but a US LLE 
performed due to the concern of an abscess revealed a new distal 
DVT on ___ in LLE. LP was deferred due to resolution of her 
headache and lack of neurologic symptoms and she was put on a 
therapeutic dose of Enoxaparin. Her lower extremity swelling 
improved and she was discharged on Enoxaparin 80mg BID.

___
She presented with Cr above baseline at 1.7 No casts were 
visualized on UA and she had a FENa of 1.7% on ___, indicating 
prerenal etiology. She was given fluids and her creatinine 
returned to baseline. Her Cr increased again on ___ to 1.4. She 
was again given IVF and her cyclosporine was decreased from 
100mg BID to 75mg BID. Cr at discharge improved to 1.2.

#Asthma
Albuterol and duonebs were given as needed

Why was I admitted to the hospital?

Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ immunocompromised female ___ 
alloSCT for secondary MDS admitted for acute change in headaches 
with new, severe symptoms such as nausea and vomiting now with 
fevers to 103 and coagulase-negative gram-positive cocci in 
clusters in blood cultures being treated for S. epidermidis 
bacteremia.

#Headache
CT head performed in the ED ___ was unremarkable but infectious 
etiology remained very high on the
differential given the patient's immunosuppression regimen and 
history of aseptic meningitis during her last admission. She 
also had history of R internal carotid cavernous sinus aneurysm 
with coiling in the past. An MRI head ___ was unremarkable. CMV, 
EBV, HSV, HHV6, adeno, ___, arboviruses, Lyme, 
crypotococcus, and fungal markers were tested and all were 
negative. The patient's headache resolved and she was symptom 
free at time of discharge. 

#S. epidermidis Bacteremia
She had fevers up to 103 on ___ and was started on vancomycin 
and cefepime. The vancomycin was DC'd ___ overnight and she was 
started on linezolid per ID recommendations as she had a history 
of VRE bacteremia in the past and was continued on cefepime. ___ 
blood culture bottles grew S. epidermidis and she was narrowed 
to vancomycin only. A chest x-ray was unremarkable for 
pneumonia. A CT chest ___ revealed no evidence of pneumonia. A 
CT abdomen pelvis ___ did not show any evidence of infection. An 
ultrasound of her port site was without evidence of infection. 
An ultrasound of her LLE ordered for concern of an abscess 
revealed a distal DVT but no fluid collections. A TTE revealed 
normal biventricular cavity sizes with mild global left 
ventricular hypokinesis, mild mitral regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology and trace aortic regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology. A TEE was scheduled but was cancelled as 
patient will need 6 weeks of therapy for treatment of possible 
septic thrombophlebitis. She was continued on Vancomycin until 
___ and was transitioned to Daptomycin on ___ as her 
Vancomycin level fluctuated frequently throughout her 
hospitalization, making dosing of the medication challenging. 
She will need to remain on Daptomycin until ___ to complete 6 
weeks of antibiotic therapy.

#Mechanical Fall
Patient had a mechanical fall during the evening of ___. She 
became incontinent of urine and slipped and fell while trying to 
make it to the bathroom. CT head and C spine were unremarkable. 
X rays of her left wrist revealed no fractures. She was given a 
hard brace based on an OT evaluation. Ecchymosis on head was 
improving at discharge. She will continue to wear the brace 
until symptoms improve.

#MDS ___ Allo MUD SCT
She was conditioned with Flu/Bu/ATG RI and was on cyclosporine 
for immunosuppression. Her home cyclosporine dosage was 75mg QAM 
and 50mg QPM. Initial cyclosporine levels were low and her 
dosage was increased to 100mg BID. Her creatinine increased on 
this dose and she was discharged on dosage of 75mg BID. Her home 
prophylaxis with fluconazole, Bactrim, and valganciclovir was 
initially continued. However, given worsening neutropenia, her 
Bactrim was transitioned to atovaquone and her valganciclovir 
was transitioned to acyclovir. She was scheduled to have a bone 
marrow biopsy with ___ as an outpatient on ___ but this was 
cancelled due to patient's new DVT. She will need to have a bone 
marrow biopsy done as an outpatient.

#DVT
Enoxaparin was held ___ for possible LP but a US LLE 
performed due to the concern of an abscess revealed a new distal 
DVT on ___ in LLE. LP was deferred due to resolution of her 
headache and lack of neurologic symptoms and she was put on a 
therapeutic dose of Enoxaparin. Her lower extremity swelling 
improved and she was discharged on Enoxaparin 80mg BID.

___
She presented with Cr above baseline at 1.7 No casts were 
visualized on UA and she had a FENa of 1.7% on ___, indicating

returned to baseline. Her Cr increased again on ___ to 1.4. She 
was again given IVF and her cyclosporine was decreased from

Conclusions

seen by 2D or color Doppler. Left ventricular wall thicknesses 
and cavity size are normal. There is mild global left

Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ immunocompromised female ___ 
alloSCT for secondary MDS admitted for acute change in headaches 
with new, severe symptoms such as nausea and vomiting now with 
fevers to 103 and coagulase-negative gram-positive cocci in 
clusters in blood cultures being treated for S. epidermidis 
bacteremia.

#Headache
CT head performed in the ED ___ was unremarkable but infectious 
etiology remained very high on the
differential given the patient's immunosuppression regimen and 
history of aseptic meningitis during her last admission. She 
also had history of R internal carotid cavernous sinus aneurysm 
with coiling in the past. An MRI head ___ was unremarkable. CMV, 
EBV, HSV, HHV6, adeno, ___, arboviruses, Lyme, 
crypotococcus, and fungal markers were tested and all were 
negative. The patient's headache resolved and she was symptom 
free at time of discharge. 

#S. epidermidis Bacteremia
She had fevers up to 103 on ___ and was started on vancomycin 
and cefepime. The vancomycin was DC'd ___ overnight and she was 
started on linezolid per ID recommendations as she had a history 
of VRE bacteremia in the past and was continued on cefepime. ___ 
blood culture bottles grew S. epidermidis and she was narrowed 
to vancomycin only. A chest x-ray was unremarkable for 
pneumonia. A CT chest ___ revealed no evidence of pneumonia. A 
CT abdomen pelvis ___ did not show any evidence of infection. An 
ultrasound of her port site was without evidence of infection. 
An ultrasound of her LLE ordered for concern of an abscess 
revealed a distal DVT but no fluid collections. A TTE revealed 
normal biventricular cavity sizes with mild global left 
ventricular hypokinesis, mild mitral regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology and trace aortic regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology. A TEE was scheduled but was cancelled as 
patient will need 6 weeks of therapy for treatment of possible 
septic thrombophlebitis. She was continued on Vancomycin until 
___ and was transitioned to Daptomycin on ___ as her 
Vancomycin level fluctuated frequently throughout her 
hospitalization, making dosing of the medication challenging. 
She will need to remain on Daptomycin until ___ to complete 6 
weeks of antibiotic therapy.

#Mechanical Fall
Patient had a mechanical fall during the evening of ___. She 
became incontinent of urine and slipped and fell while trying to 
make it to the bathroom. CT head and C spine were unremarkable. 
X rays of her left wrist revealed no fractures. She was given a 
hard brace based on an OT evaluation. Ecchymosis on head was 
improving at discharge. She will continue to wear the brace 
until symptoms improve.

#MDS ___ Allo MUD SCT
She was conditioned with Flu/Bu/ATG RI and was on cyclosporine 
for immunosuppression. Her home cyclosporine dosage was 75mg QAM 
and 50mg QPM. Initial cyclosporine levels were low and her 
dosage was increased to 100mg BID. Her creatinine increased on 
this dose and she was discharged on dosage of 75mg BID. Her home 
prophylaxis with fluconazole, Bactrim, and valganciclovir was 
initially continued. However, given worsening neutropenia, her 
Bactrim was transitioned to atovaquone and her valganciclovir 
was transitioned to acyclovir. She was scheduled to have a bone 
marrow biopsy with ___ as an outpatient on ___ but this was 
cancelled due to patient's new DVT. She will need to have a bone 
marrow biopsy done as an outpatient.

#DVT
Enoxaparin was held ___ for possible LP but a US LLE 
performed due to the concern of an abscess revealed a new distal 
DVT on ___ in LLE. LP was deferred due to resolution of her 
headache and lack of neurologic symptoms and she was put on a 
therapeutic dose of Enoxaparin. Her lower extremity swelling 
improved and she was discharged on Enoxaparin 80mg BID.

___
She presented with Cr above baseline at 1.7 No casts were 
visualized on UA and she had a FENa of 1.7% on ___, indicating 
prerenal etiology. She was given fluids and her creatinine 
returned to baseline. Her Cr increased again on ___ to 1.4. She 
was again given IVF and her cyclosporine was decreased from 
100mg BID to 75mg BID. Cr at discharge improved to 1.2.

#Asthma
Albuterol and duonebs were given as needed

Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ immunocompromised female ___ 
alloSCT for secondary MDS admitted for acute change in headaches 
with new, severe symptoms such as nausea and vomiting now with 
fevers to 103 and coagulase-negative gram-positive cocci in 
clusters in blood cultures being treated for S. epidermidis 
bacteremia.

#Headache
CT head performed in the ED ___ was unremarkable but infectious 
etiology remained very high on the
differential given the patient's immunosuppression regimen and 
history of aseptic meningitis during her last admission. She 
also had history of R internal carotid cavernous sinus aneurysm 
with coiling in the past. An MRI head ___ was unremarkable. CMV, 
EBV, HSV, HHV6, adeno, ___, arboviruses, Lyme, 
crypotococcus, and fungal markers were tested and all were 
negative. The patient's headache resolved and she was symptom 
free at time of discharge. 

#S. epidermidis Bacteremia
She had fevers up to 103 on ___ and was started on vancomycin 
and cefepime. The vancomycin was DC'd ___ overnight and she was 
started on linezolid per ID recommendations as she had a history 
of VRE bacteremia in the past and was continued on cefepime. ___ 
blood culture bottles grew S. epidermidis and she was narrowed 
to vancomycin only. A chest x-ray was unremarkable for 
pneumonia. A CT chest ___ revealed no evidence of pneumonia. A 
CT abdomen pelvis ___ did not show any evidence of infection. An 
ultrasound of her port site was without evidence of infection. 
An ultrasound of her LLE ordered for concern of an abscess 
revealed a distal DVT but no fluid collections. A TTE revealed 
normal biventricular cavity sizes with mild global left 
ventricular hypokinesis, mild mitral regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology and trace aortic regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology. A TEE was scheduled but was cancelled as 
patient will need 6 weeks of therapy for treatment of possible 
septic thrombophlebitis. She was continued on Vancomycin until 
___ and was transitioned to Daptomycin on ___ as her 
Vancomycin level fluctuated frequently throughout her 
hospitalization, making dosing of the medication challenging. 
She will need to remain on Daptomycin until ___ to complete 6 
weeks of antibiotic therapy.

#Mechanical Fall
Patient had a mechanical fall during the evening of ___. She 
became incontinent of urine and slipped and fell while trying to 
make it to the bathroom. CT head and C spine were unremarkable. 
X rays of her left wrist revealed no fractures. She was given a 
hard brace based on an OT evaluation. Ecchymosis on head was 
improving at discharge. She will continue to wear the brace 
until symptoms improve.

#MDS ___ Allo MUD SCT
She was conditioned with Flu/Bu/ATG RI and was on cyclosporine 
for immunosuppression. Her home cyclosporine dosage was 75mg QAM 
and 50mg QPM. Initial cyclosporine levels were low and her 
dosage was increased to 100mg BID. Her creatinine increased on 
this dose and she was discharged on dosage of 75mg BID. Her home 
prophylaxis with fluconazole, Bactrim, and valganciclovir was 
initially continued. However, given worsening neutropenia, her 
Bactrim was transitioned to atovaquone and her valganciclovir 
was transitioned to acyclovir. She was scheduled to have a bone 
marrow biopsy with ___ as an outpatient on ___ but this was 
cancelled due to patient's new DVT. She will need to have a bone 
marrow biopsy done as an outpatient.

#DVT
Enoxaparin was held ___ for possible LP but a US LLE 
performed due to the concern of an abscess revealed a new distal 
DVT on ___ in LLE. LP was deferred due to resolution of her 
headache and lack of neurologic symptoms and she was put on a 
therapeutic dose of Enoxaparin. Her lower extremity swelling 
improved and she was discharged on Enoxaparin 80mg BID.

___
She presented with Cr above baseline at 1.7 No casts were 
visualized on UA and she had a FENa of 1.7% on ___, indicating 
prerenal etiology. She was given fluids and her creatinine 
returned to baseline. Her Cr increased again on ___ to 1.4. She 
was again given IVF and her cyclosporine was decreased from 
100mg BID to 75mg BID. Cr at discharge improved to 1.2.

#Asthma
Albuterol and duonebs were given as needed

Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ immunocompromised female ___ 
alloSCT for secondary MDS admitted for acute change in headaches 
with new, severe symptoms such as nausea and vomiting now with 
fevers to 103 and coagulase-negative gram-positive cocci in 
clusters in blood cultures being treated for S. epidermidis 
bacteremia.

#Headache
CT head performed in the ED ___ was unremarkable but infectious 
etiology remained very high on the
differential given the patient's immunosuppression regimen and 
history of aseptic meningitis during her last admission. She 
also had history of R internal carotid cavernous sinus aneurysm 
with coiling in the past. An MRI head ___ was unremarkable. CMV, 
EBV, HSV, HHV6, adeno, ___, arboviruses, Lyme, 
crypotococcus, and fungal markers were tested and all were 
negative. The patient's headache resolved and she was symptom 
free at time of discharge. 

#S. epidermidis Bacteremia
She had fevers up to 103 on ___ and was started on vancomycin 
and cefepime. The vancomycin was DC'd ___ overnight and she was 
started on linezolid per ID recommendations as she had a history 
of VRE bacteremia in the past and was continued on cefepime. ___ 
blood culture bottles grew S. epidermidis and she was narrowed 
to vancomycin only. A chest x-ray was unremarkable for 
pneumonia. A CT chest ___ revealed no evidence of pneumonia. A 
CT abdomen pelvis ___ did not show any evidence of infection. An 
ultrasound of her port site was without evidence of infection. 
An ultrasound of her LLE ordered for concern of an abscess 
revealed a distal DVT but no fluid collections. A TTE revealed 
normal biventricular cavity sizes with mild global left 
ventricular hypokinesis, mild mitral regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology and trace aortic regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology. A TEE was scheduled but was cancelled as 
patient will need 6 weeks of therapy for treatment of possible 
septic thrombophlebitis. She was continued on Vancomycin until 
___ and was transitioned to Daptomycin on ___ as her 
Vancomycin level fluctuated frequently throughout her 
hospitalization, making dosing of the medication challenging. 
She will need to remain on Daptomycin until ___ to complete 6 
weeks of antibiotic therapy.

#Mechanical Fall
Patient had a mechanical fall during the evening of ___. She 
became incontinent of urine and slipped and fell while trying to 
make it to the bathroom. CT head and C spine were unremarkable. 
X rays of her left wrist revealed no fractures. She was given a 
hard brace based on an OT evaluation. Ecchymosis on head was 
improving at discharge. She will continue to wear the brace 
until symptoms improve.

#MDS ___ Allo MUD SCT
She was conditioned with Flu/Bu/ATG RI and was on cyclosporine 
for immunosuppression. Her home cyclosporine dosage was 75mg QAM 
and 50mg QPM. Initial cyclosporine levels were low and her 
dosage was increased to 100mg BID. Her creatinine increased on 
this dose and she was discharged on dosage of 75mg BID. Her home 
prophylaxis with fluconazole, Bactrim, and valganciclovir was 
initially continued. However, given worsening neutropenia, her 
Bactrim was transitioned to atovaquone and her valganciclovir 
was transitioned to acyclovir. She was scheduled to have a bone 
marrow biopsy with ___ as an outpatient on ___ but this was 
cancelled due to patient's new DVT. She will need to have a bone 
marrow biopsy done as an outpatient.

#DVT
Enoxaparin was held ___ for possible LP but a US LLE 
performed due to the concern of an abscess revealed a new distal 
DVT on ___ in LLE. LP was deferred due to resolution of her 
headache and lack of neurologic symptoms and she was put on a 
therapeutic dose of Enoxaparin. Her lower extremity swelling 
improved and she was discharged on Enoxaparin 80mg BID.

___
She presented with Cr above baseline at 1.7 No casts were 
visualized on UA and she had a FENa of 1.7% on ___, indicating 
prerenal etiology. She was given fluids and her creatinine 
returned to baseline. Her Cr increased again on ___ to 1.4. She 
was again given IVF and her cyclosporine was decreased from

Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ immunocompromised female ___ 
alloSCT for secondary MDS admitted for acute change in headaches 
with new, severe symptoms such as nausea and vomiting now with 
fevers to 103 and coagulase-negative gram-positive cocci in 
clusters in blood cultures being treated for S. epidermidis 
bacteremia.

#Headache
CT head performed in the ED ___ was unremarkable but infectious 
etiology remained very high on the
differential given the patient's immunosuppression regimen and 
history of aseptic meningitis during her last admission. She 
also had history of R internal carotid cavernous sinus aneurysm 
with coiling in the past. An MRI head ___ was unremarkable. CMV, 
EBV, HSV, HHV6, adeno, ___, arboviruses, Lyme, 
crypotococcus, and fungal markers were tested and all were 
negative. The patient's headache resolved and she was symptom 
free at time of discharge. 

#S. epidermidis Bacteremia
She had fevers up to 103 on ___ and was started on vancomycin 
and cefepime. The vancomycin was DC'd ___ overnight and she was 
started on linezolid per ID recommendations as she had a history 
of VRE bacteremia in the past and was continued on cefepime. ___ 
blood culture bottles grew S. epidermidis and she was narrowed 
to vancomycin only. A chest x-ray was unremarkable for 
pneumonia. A CT chest ___ revealed no evidence of pneumonia. A 
CT abdomen pelvis ___ did not show any evidence of infection. An 
ultrasound of her port site was without evidence of infection. 
An ultrasound of her LLE ordered for concern of an abscess 
revealed a distal DVT but no fluid collections. A TTE revealed 
normal biventricular cavity sizes with mild global left 
ventricular hypokinesis, mild mitral regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology and trace aortic regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology. A TEE was scheduled but was cancelled as 
patient will need 6 weeks of therapy for treatment of possible 
septic thrombophlebitis. She was continued on Vancomycin until 
___ and was transitioned to Daptomycin on ___ as her 
Vancomycin level fluctuated frequently throughout her 
hospitalization, making dosing of the medication challenging. 
She will need to remain on Daptomycin until ___ to complete 6 
weeks of antibiotic therapy.

#Mechanical Fall
Patient had a mechanical fall during the evening of ___. She 
became incontinent of urine and slipped and fell while trying to 
make it to the bathroom. CT head and C spine were unremarkable. 
X rays of her left wrist revealed no fractures. She was given a 
hard brace based on an OT evaluation. Ecchymosis on head was 
improving at discharge. She will continue to wear the brace 
until symptoms improve.

#MDS ___ Allo MUD SCT
She was conditioned with Flu/Bu/ATG RI and was on cyclosporine 
for immunosuppression. Her home cyclosporine dosage was 75mg QAM 
and 50mg QPM. Initial cyclosporine levels were low and her 
dosage was increased to 100mg BID. Her creatinine increased on 
this dose and she was discharged on dosage of 75mg BID. Her home 
prophylaxis with fluconazole, Bactrim, and valganciclovir was 
initially continued. However, given worsening neutropenia, her 
Bactrim was transitioned to atovaquone and her valganciclovir 
was transitioned to acyclovir. She was scheduled to have a bone 
marrow biopsy with ___ as an outpatient on ___ but this was 
cancelled due to patient's new DVT. She will need to have a bone 
marrow biopsy done as an outpatient.

#DVT
Enoxaparin was held ___ for possible LP but a US LLE 
performed due to the concern of an abscess revealed a new distal 
DVT on ___ in LLE. LP was deferred due to resolution of her 
headache and lack of neurologic symptoms and she was put on a 
therapeutic dose of Enoxaparin. Her lower extremity swelling 
improved and she was discharged on Enoxaparin 80mg BID.

___
She presented with Cr above baseline at 1.7 No casts were 
visualized on UA and she had a FENa of 1.7% on ___, indicating 
prerenal etiology. She was given fluids and her creatinine 
returned to baseline. Her Cr increased again on ___ to 1.4. She 
was again given IVF and her cyclosporine was decreased from 
100mg BID to 75mg BID. Cr at discharge improved to 1.2.

#Asthma
Albuterol and duonebs were given as needed

prolapse. No mass or vegetation is seen on the mitral valve.

systolic pressure could not be determined. There is no 
pericardial effusion.

left ventricular hypokinesis. Mild mitral regurgitation with

Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ immunocompromised female ___ 
alloSCT for secondary MDS admitted for acute change in headaches 
with new, severe symptoms such as nausea and vomiting now with 
fevers to 103 and coagulase-negative gram-positive cocci in 
clusters in blood cultures being treated for S. epidermidis 
bacteremia.

#Headache
CT head performed in the ED ___ was unremarkable but infectious 
etiology remained very high on the
differential given the patient's immunosuppression regimen and 
history of aseptic meningitis during her last admission. She 
also had history of R internal carotid cavernous sinus aneurysm 
with coiling in the past. An MRI head ___ was unremarkable. CMV, 
EBV, HSV, HHV6, adeno, ___, arboviruses, Lyme, 
crypotococcus, and fungal markers were tested and all were 
negative. The patient's headache resolved and she was symptom 
free at time of discharge. 

#S. epidermidis Bacteremia
She had fevers up to 103 on ___ and was started on vancomycin 
and cefepime. The vancomycin was DC'd ___ overnight and she was 
started on linezolid per ID recommendations as she had a history 
of VRE bacteremia in the past and was continued on cefepime. ___ 
blood culture bottles grew S. epidermidis and she was narrowed 
to vancomycin only. A chest x-ray was unremarkable for 
pneumonia. A CT chest ___ revealed no evidence of pneumonia. A 
CT abdomen pelvis ___ did not show any evidence of infection. An 
ultrasound of her port site was without evidence of infection. 
An ultrasound of her LLE ordered for concern of an abscess 
revealed a distal DVT but no fluid collections. A TTE revealed 
normal biventricular cavity sizes with mild global left 
ventricular hypokinesis, mild mitral regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology and trace aortic regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology. A TEE was scheduled but was cancelled as 
patient will need 6 weeks of therapy for treatment of possible 
septic thrombophlebitis. She was continued on Vancomycin until 
___ and was transitioned to Daptomycin on ___ as her 
Vancomycin level fluctuated frequently throughout her 
hospitalization, making dosing of the medication challenging. 
She will need to remain on Daptomycin until ___ to complete 6 
weeks of antibiotic therapy.

#Mechanical Fall
Patient had a mechanical fall during the evening of ___. She 
became incontinent of urine and slipped and fell while trying to 
make it to the bathroom. CT head and C spine were unremarkable. 
X rays of her left wrist revealed no fractures. She was given a 
hard brace based on an OT evaluation. Ecchymosis on head was 
improving at discharge. She will continue to wear the brace 
until symptoms improve.

#MDS ___ Allo MUD SCT
She was conditioned with Flu/Bu/ATG RI and was on cyclosporine 
for immunosuppression. Her home cyclosporine dosage was 75mg QAM 
and 50mg QPM. Initial cyclosporine levels were low and her 
dosage was increased to 100mg BID. Her creatinine increased on 
this dose and she was discharged on dosage of 75mg BID. Her home 
prophylaxis with fluconazole, Bactrim, and valganciclovir was 
initially continued. However, given worsening neutropenia, her 
Bactrim was transitioned to atovaquone and her valganciclovir 
was transitioned to acyclovir. She was scheduled to have a bone 
marrow biopsy with ___ as an outpatient on ___ but this was 
cancelled due to patient's new DVT. She will need to have a bone 
marrow biopsy done as an outpatient.

#DVT
Enoxaparin was held ___ for possible LP but a US LLE 
performed due to the concern of an abscess revealed a new distal 
DVT on ___ in LLE. LP was deferred due to resolution of her 
headache and lack of neurologic symptoms and she was put on a 
therapeutic dose of Enoxaparin. Her lower extremity swelling 
improved and she was discharged on Enoxaparin 80mg BID.

Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ immunocompromised female ___ 
alloSCT for secondary MDS admitted for acute change in headaches 
with new, severe symptoms such as nausea and vomiting now with 
fevers to 103 and coagulase-negative gram-positive cocci in 
clusters in blood cultures being treated for S. epidermidis 
bacteremia.

#Headache
CT head performed in the ED ___ was unremarkable but infectious 
etiology remained very high on the
differential given the patient's immunosuppression regimen and 
history of aseptic meningitis during her last admission. She 
also had history of R internal carotid cavernous sinus aneurysm 
with coiling in the past. An MRI head ___ was unremarkable. CMV, 
EBV, HSV, HHV6, adeno, ___, arboviruses, Lyme, 
crypotococcus, and fungal markers were tested and all were 
negative. The patient's headache resolved and she was symptom 
free at time of discharge. 

#S. epidermidis Bacteremia
She had fevers up to 103 on ___ and was started on vancomycin 
and cefepime. The vancomycin was DC'd ___ overnight and she was 
started on linezolid per ID recommendations as she had a history 
of VRE bacteremia in the past and was continued on cefepime. ___ 
blood culture bottles grew S. epidermidis and she was narrowed 
to vancomycin only. A chest x-ray was unremarkable for 
pneumonia. A CT chest ___ revealed no evidence of pneumonia. A 
CT abdomen pelvis ___ did not show any evidence of infection. An 
ultrasound of her port site was without evidence of infection. 
An ultrasound of her LLE ordered for concern of an abscess 
revealed a distal DVT but no fluid collections. A TTE revealed 
normal biventricular cavity sizes with mild global left 
ventricular hypokinesis, mild mitral regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology and trace aortic regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology. A TEE was scheduled but was cancelled as 
patient will need 6 weeks of therapy for treatment of possible 
septic thrombophlebitis. She was continued on Vancomycin until 
___ and was transitioned to Daptomycin on ___ as her 
Vancomycin level fluctuated frequently throughout her 
hospitalization, making dosing of the medication challenging. 
She will need to remain on Daptomycin until ___ to complete 6 
weeks of antibiotic therapy.

#Mechanical Fall
Patient had a mechanical fall during the evening of ___. She 
became incontinent of urine and slipped and fell while trying to 
make it to the bathroom. CT head and C spine were unremarkable. 
X rays of her left wrist revealed no fractures. She was given a 
hard brace based on an OT evaluation. Ecchymosis on head was 
improving at discharge. She will continue to wear the brace 
until symptoms improve.

#MDS ___ Allo MUD SCT
She was conditioned with Flu/Bu/ATG RI and was on cyclosporine 
for immunosuppression. Her home cyclosporine dosage was 75mg QAM 
and 50mg QPM. Initial cyclosporine levels were low and her 
dosage was increased to 100mg BID. Her creatinine increased on 
this dose and she was discharged on dosage of 75mg BID. Her home 
prophylaxis with fluconazole, Bactrim, and valganciclovir was 
initially continued. However, given worsening neutropenia, her 
Bactrim was transitioned to atovaquone and her valganciclovir 
was transitioned to acyclovir. She was scheduled to have a bone 
marrow biopsy with ___ as an outpatient on ___ but this was 
cancelled due to patient's new DVT. She will need to have a bone 
marrow biopsy done as an outpatient.

#DVT
Enoxaparin was held ___ for possible LP but a US LLE 
performed due to the concern of an abscess revealed a new distal 
DVT on ___ in LLE. LP was deferred due to resolution of her 
headache and lack of neurologic symptoms and she was put on a 
therapeutic dose of Enoxaparin. Her lower extremity swelling 
improved and she was discharged on Enoxaparin 80mg BID.

___
She presented with Cr above baseline at 1.7 No casts were 
visualized on UA and she had a FENa of 1.7% on ___, indicating 
prerenal etiology. She was given fluids and her creatinine 
returned to baseline. Her Cr increased again on ___ to 1.4. She 
was again given IVF and her cyclosporine was decreased from 
100mg BID to 75mg BID. Cr at discharge improved to 1.2.

#Asthma
Albuterol and duonebs were given as needed

brain.

What happened while I was admitted in the hospital?

-You were started on antibiotics to treat your bacterial 
infection
-Imaging of your leg showed you had a clot in your leg

were started on Atovaquone and Acyclovir.

What should I do after I get discharged from the hospital?

Your ___ Oncology Team

Brief Hospital Course:
Ms. ___ is a ___ immunocompromised female ___ 
alloSCT for secondary MDS admitted for acute change in headaches 
with new, severe symptoms such as nausea and vomiting now with 
fevers to 103 and coagulase-negative gram-positive cocci in 
clusters in blood cultures being treated for S. epidermidis 
bacteremia.

#Headache
CT head performed in the ED ___ was unremarkable but infectious 
etiology remained very high on the
differential given the patient's immunosuppression regimen and 
history of aseptic meningitis during her last admission. She 
also had history of R internal carotid cavernous sinus aneurysm 
with coiling in the past. An MRI head ___ was unremarkable. CMV, 
EBV, HSV, HHV6, adeno, ___, arboviruses, Lyme, 
crypotococcus, and fungal markers were tested and all were 
negative. The patient's headache resolved and she was symptom 
free at time of discharge. 

#S. epidermidis Bacteremia
She had fevers up to 103 on ___ and was started on vancomycin 
and cefepime. The vancomycin was DC'd ___ overnight and she was 
started on linezolid per ID recommendations as she had a history 
of VRE bacteremia in the past and was continued on cefepime. ___ 
blood culture bottles grew S. epidermidis and she was narrowed 
to vancomycin only. A chest x-ray was unremarkable for 
pneumonia. A CT chest ___ revealed no evidence of pneumonia. A 
CT abdomen pelvis ___ did not show any evidence of infection. An 
ultrasound of her port site was without evidence of infection. 
An ultrasound of her LLE ordered for concern of an abscess 
revealed a distal DVT but no fluid collections. A TTE revealed 
normal biventricular cavity sizes with mild global left 
ventricular hypokinesis, mild mitral regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology and trace aortic regurgitation with normal 
valve morphology. A TEE was scheduled but was cancelled as 
patient will need 6 weeks of therapy for treatment of possible 
septic thrombophlebitis. She was continued on Vancomycin until 
___ and was transitioned to Daptomycin on ___ as her 
Vancomycin level fluctuated frequently throughout her 
hospitalization, making dosing of the medication challenging. 
She will need to remain on Daptomycin until ___ to complete 6 
weeks of antibiotic therapy.

#Mechanical Fall
Patient had a mechanical fall during the evening of ___. She 
became incontinent of urine and slipped and fell while trying to 
make it to the bathroom. CT head and C spine were unremarkable. 
X rays of her left wrist revealed no fractures. She was given a 
hard brace based on an OT evaluation. Ecchymosis on head was 
improving at discharge. She will continue to wear the brace 
until symptoms improve.

#MDS ___ Allo MUD SCT
She was conditioned with Flu/Bu/ATG RI and was on cyclosporine 
for immunosuppression. Her home cyclosporine dosage was 75mg QAM 
and 50mg QPM. Initial cyclosporine levels were low and her 
dosage was increased to 100mg BID. Her creatinine increased on 
this dose and she was discharged on dosage of 75mg BID. Her home 
prophylaxis with fluconazole, Bactrim, and valganciclovir was 
initially continued. However, given worsening neutropenia, her 
Bactrim was transitioned to atovaquone and her valganciclovir 
was transitioned to acyclovir. She was scheduled to have a bone 
marrow biopsy with ___ as an outpatient on ___ but this was 
cancelled due to patient's new DVT. She will need to have a bone 
marrow biopsy done as an outpatient.

#DVT
Enoxaparin was held ___ for possible LP but a US LLE 
performed due to the concern of an abscess revealed a new distal 
DVT on ___ in LLE. LP was deferred due to resolution of her 
headache and lack of neurologic symptoms and she was put on a 
therapeutic dose of Enoxaparin. Her lower extremity swelling 
improved and she was discharged on Enoxaparin 80mg BID.

___
She presented with Cr above baseline at 1.7 No casts were 
visualized on UA and she had a FENa of 1.7% on ___, indicating 
prerenal etiology. She was given fluids and her creatinine 
returned to baseline. Her Cr increased again on ___ to 1.4. She 
was again given IVF and her cyclosporine was decreased from 
100mg BID to 75mg BID. Cr at discharge improved to 1.2.

#Asthma
Albuterol and duonebs were given as needed

prompting call to her oncologist's office who referred her to

Brief Hospital Course:
___ female with history of diffuse large B-cell lymphoma 
complicated by secondary myelodysplastic syndrome status-post 
allogeneic stem cell transplant complicated by combined variable 
immunodeficiency status-post IVIG, CMV viremia status-post 
ganciclovir/valganciclovir and S. epidermidis bactermia 
status-post daptomycin, new deep venous thrombosis, on Lovenox, 
and recent biopsy-proven acute skin graft-versus-host disease, 
on triamcinolone / prednisone, admitted for (1) worsening skin 
erythema, which resolved with high-dose corticosteroids and (2) 
diarrhea, which spontaneously resolved upon admission.

#) Skin graft-versus-host disease, acute, grade III: punch 
biopsy (___) favoring GvHD versus drug eruption. Acute 
worsening of generalized eryhtroderma with xerosis/desquamation 
in days preceding admission despite use of 
triamcinolone/prednisone. No cellulitic changes. Erythema 
regressed with five-day course of methylprednisolone 1 mg/kg in 
combination with topical triamcinolone 0.1%/hydrocortisone 1% 
(face), which was converted to prednisone 100 -> 80 mg daily 
thereafter. Further taper plan to be determined as outpatient. 
Hydroxyzine, Sarna, and emollients added for symptomatic care.

#) Diarrhea, non-bloody: concern for acute gut GvHD, though 
spontaneously resolved prior to start of high-dose 
corticosteroids. Of note, recent protracted antibiotic course, 
though C. difficile negative. CMV viral load and stool studies 
likewise negative. Stool volume normal throughout duration of 
hospital course. Flexible sigmoidoscopy not pursued in that 
regard.

#) ___: Cr bumped to 1.4 shortly prior to discharge. Unclear 
etiology though most suspicious for cyclosporine effect vs. 
hypovolemia. Non-fluid responsive to 1L bolus; urine studies 
with intrinsic renal picture. Spontaneously resolved within 24 
h. Of note, given fluid bolus in setting of HFrEF and concurrent 
steroids patient was mildly volume overloaded at time of 
discharge. No shortness of breath; O2 saturation normal. 
Discharged with 20 mg PO Lasix.

#) DLBCL c/b secondary MDS ___ MUD allogeneic SCT, in remission: 
100% chimerism ___ surveillance bone marrow biopsy with 
normal trilineage maturation. DLBCL also in remission by 
surveillance CT. Complications, as delineated above. 
Cyclosporine as well as acyclovir, fluconazole, and TMP/SMX all 
continued.

cyclosporine and TMP/SMX.

erythema, which resolved with high-dose corticosteroids and (2) 
diarrhea, which spontaneously resolved upon admission.

#) Skin graft-versus-host disease, acute, grade III: punch 
biopsy (___) favoring GvHD versus drug eruption. Acute 
worsening of generalized eryhtroderma with xerosis/desquamation 
in days preceding admission despite use of 
triamcinolone/prednisone. No cellulitic changes. Erythema 
regressed with five-day course of methylprednisolone 1 mg/kg in 
combination with topical triamcinolone 0.1%/hydrocortisone 1% 
(face), which was converted to prednisone 100 -> 80 mg daily 
thereafter. Further taper plan to be determined as outpatient. 
Hydroxyzine, Sarna, and emollients added for symptomatic care.

#) Diarrhea, non-bloody: concern for acute gut GvHD, though 
spontaneously resolved prior to start of high-dose 
corticosteroids. Of note, recent protracted antibiotic course, 
though C. difficile negative. CMV viral load and stool studies 
likewise negative. Stool volume normal throughout duration of 
hospital course. Flexible sigmoidoscopy not pursued in that 
regard.

#) ___: Cr bumped to 1.4 shortly prior to discharge. Unclear 
etiology though most suspicious for cyclosporine effect vs. 
hypovolemia. Non-fluid responsive to 1L bolus; urine studies 
with intrinsic renal picture. Spontaneously resolved within 24 
h. Of note, given fluid bolus in setting of HFrEF and concurrent 
steroids patient was mildly volume overloaded at time of 
discharge. No shortness of breath; O2 saturation normal. 
Discharged with 20 mg PO Lasix.

#) DLBCL c/b secondary MDS ___ MUD allogeneic SCT, in remission: 
100% chimerism ___ surveillance bone marrow biopsy with 
normal trilineage maturation. DLBCL also in remission by 
surveillance CT. Complications, as delineated above. 
Cyclosporine as well as acyclovir, fluconazole, and TMP/SMX all 
continued. 

#) Hyperkalemia, mild: suspect iatrogenic secondary to 
cyclosporine and TMP/SMX. 

CHRONIC/STABLE ISSUES
==============================

#) DVT, bilateral lower extremity: on therapeutic Lovenox, as of 
___. Of note, ___ IVC filter (___) for prior DVT. Lovenox 80 
mg SC Q12H continued. 

#) ICA cavernous sinus aneurysm, right: ___ coil embolization 
c/b CN VI palsy, ptosis, V1 hyperesthesia. Home gabapentin 
continued. 

#) GERD: home omeprazole continued.

#) OSA: nocturnal CPAP

TRANSITIONAL ISSUES
===============================
 [ ] Discharged on prednisone 80 mg daily. Please arrange for 
taper as outpatient.

steroids patient was mildly volume overloaded at time of

status-post daptomycin, new deep venous thrombosis, on Lovenox, 
and recent biopsy-proven acute skin graft-versus-host disease, 
on triamcinolone / prednisone, admitted for (1) worsening skin 
erythema, which resolved with high-dose corticosteroids and (2) 
diarrhea, which spontaneously resolved upon admission.

#) Skin graft-versus-host disease, acute, grade III: punch 
biopsy (___) favoring GvHD versus drug eruption. Acute 
worsening of generalized eryhtroderma with xerosis/desquamation 
in days preceding admission despite use of 
triamcinolone/prednisone. No cellulitic changes. Erythema 
regressed with five-day course of methylprednisolone 1 mg/kg in 
combination with topical triamcinolone 0.1%/hydrocortisone 1%

corticosteroids. Of note, recent protracted antibiotic course, 
though C. difficile negative. CMV viral load and stool studies 
likewise negative. Stool volume normal throughout duration of 
hospital course. Flexible sigmoidoscopy not pursued in that 
regard.

all the best!

History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old female with transformed DLBCL with 
a
history of stage IIA follicular lymphoma with treatment
related MDS ___ allogeneic stem cell transplant on ___ who
presents with four days of productive cough, fevers and chills.

She called her ___ clinic on ___ and reported fever,
chills, and productive cough. She had been seen at urgent care
earlier on ___ and received CXR which was consistent with
pneumonia, and she was treated with ceftriaxone 1g, steroids and
DuoNebs. She called ___ clinic due to lack of improvement.
She was referred to ED for admission and IV antibiotics, given
her pneumonia and history of allogenic transplant.

In the ED, her vitals were: T 98.8, HR 96, BP 129/65, RR 18, 
SPO2
97% RA. Lung exam was significant for diffuse expiratory 
wheezing
and rhonchi. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13, HGB 13, plt 256, K
4.6, Cr 1.2. She was given azithromycin, albuterol nebs, DuoNeb,
IVF.

On arrival to OMED, she reports she has laryngitis and continued
cough. She has multiple sick contacts (grandchildren at home who
have colds). She denies current fever, chills, abdominal pain,
nausea, diarrhea, dysuria, leg swelling.

REVIEW OF SYSTEMS:  
A complete 10-point review of systems was performed and was
negative unless otherwise noted in the HPI.  
 
Past Medical History:
PAST ONCOLOGIC HISTORY: 
 Transformed DLBCL with a history of follicular lymphoma stage
IIA
- ___ developed worsening musculoskeletal back pain, early
satiety, hypoalbuminemia and found to have mesenteric mass
- ?___ ex lap with 15 cm lobulated mass involving the
duodenum, retroperitoneum and celiac access.  Biopsies showed
Follicular lymphomas grade II/III.  Reportedly negative staging
Gallium scan. CD10+ BCL2+
- ___ completed 6 cycles CHOP, complications included
SVC/innominate thrombus (tPA)
- ___ CT showed persistent 7 x 3.5 x 9 cm oblong mass, bone
marrow at completion was negative for lymphomatous involvement.
- ___ PET-CT with very slight amount of increased tracer
activity within the posterior left supraclavicular region. No
other areas of FDG avid disease were noted 
- ___ through ___ per records she was treated with CVP
followed by course of single agent Rituxan
- ___ through ___ surveillance imaging with no evidence of
recurrent disease, stable mesenteric mass.
- ___ abdominal pain led to CT with no change in mass size,
increased conspicuity of nodular borders
- ___ PET-CT with L. hilar LN PET-avid to SUV 7.9, otherwise
stable mesenteric mass with low level SUV 2.2 stable since 
prior.
- ___ CT torso showed persistent mesenteric and left hilar
lymphadenopathy. Stable right middle lobe small focus of ground
glass opacity and adjacent subpleural fat hypertrophy, 
suggestive
of inflammatory process. Stable right adnexal cyst.  
- ___ Presented to PCP ___ ___iscomfort. 
Exam
revealed new adenopathy. Labs notable for LDH 341, WBC 10.1,
normal differential, PLT 452. 
- ___ PET CT revealed, "Large left cervical,
supraclavicular, mediastinal lymphadenopathy, and 
retroperitoneal
lymphadenopathy, and small mesenteric
lymphadenopathy, all markedly FDG-avid and concerning for
lymphoma." SUVmax 35.5.
- ___iopsy revealed diffuse large B cell
lymphoma, CD20+ CD10+ lambda restricted. MIB and cytogenetics 
are
pending
- ___ C1D1 ICE
- ___ C1 Rituximab, clinically improved adenopathy
- ___ C2 Rituximab, WBC 6.5, PLT 43
- ___ Admit for C2D1 ICE
- ___ C3 Rituximab
- ___ PET CT showed almost complete resolution of FDG avid
disease with a residual focus of avidity in the bed of the 
former
abdominal mass, SUV 3
- ___ C4 Rituximab
- ___ C4 ICE followed by stem cell mobilization and
collection, BMBx showed a nest of CLL unrelated to her 
aggressive
lymphoma
- ___ Presented with large DVTs, SVC filter placed
- ___ D0 of a BEAM autoSCT, course notable for mucositis
- ___ Switched to Rivaroxiban for AC
- ___ PET CT ___, PFTs with normal Hb adjusted DLCO
- ___ IVIg 400 mg/kg c/b fever, aseptic meningitis,
cytopenias
- ___ Started IFRT to paraaortic LNs, 3600 cGy total dose.
- ___, Norovirus
- ___ Presented with dyspnea, DLCO 79% predicted (adjusted
for Hb). Started prednisone 80 mg PO daily and adjusted with
DLCO.  Finally d/ced ___. 
- IVIg 400 mg/kg, continues monthly for
Hypogammaglobuonemia/CVID.
- ___, CT torso with no evidence of active disease. Stable
appearance of a conglomeration of mesenteric lymph nodes. 
- ___, Right total knee replacement, complicated by foot
drop likely due to irritation of peroneal nerve from the CPM
machine, as well as a cellulitis of the right leg; same leg as
her previous DVT and her circulation is poor. 
- ___, CT Torso with no evidence of active disease. 
Stable appearance of conglomerate of mesenteric LN's. Increased
dilatation of the main pulmonary artery suggests worsening
pulmonary arterial hypertension of indeterminate etiology.
- ___, CT torso with no evidence of active disease. Increased
dilation of pulmonary artery.  Evaluated by Dr. ___
- ___, Increasing right leg swelling and shortness of breath
with noted DVT; no DVT.  Xarelto increased back to 20 mg
daily(had been decreased given age and prior chronic DVT).  No
evidence for lymphoma on CT imaging.
- ___, noted drop in blood counts. Bone marrow biopsy showed
dysplasia in all cell lines with ~ 6% blasts noted in aspirate. 
Cytogenetics showing multiple abnormalities. 
- ___, C1 Dacogen
- ___, admitted with fever in setting of neutropenia, and
increasing right sided back pain.  No infectious source found;
after consultation with ID, it was decided to treat empirically
for presumptive osteomyelitis/discitis with 6 weeks of 
vancomycin
(750mg IV q12h), cefepime (2g IV q12h), micafungin (100 mg PO
q24h).  Required short time of pain medicines for back pain. 
- ___, C2 Dacogen
- ___, admitted with increased confusion and issues of
word finding.  Head CT and MRI of the head did not show any
abnormality.  Treated with concern for meningitis and remained 
on
her other antibiotics for treatment of presumed osteomyelitis. 
Confusion resolved and no infectious etiology was noted except
for possible UTI. 
- ___, Admitted with 2 days of nausea, vomiting, fever,
confusion, and urinary incontinence, with infectious workup,
overall negative, except for positive coronavirus.  CTA negative
for PE and there was no evidence of pulmonary or abdominal
infection on imaging.  MRI of brain was negative for an
intracranial process; MRI spine was negative for abscess or
osteomyelitis. 
- ___, C3 Dacogen and discharged to home on ___.
- ___, Admitted with diarrhea, decreased appetite. 
Received IVF support, transfusions and potassium replacement;
discharged on ___. 
- ___, C4 Dacogen
- ___, Admitted with cough and wheezing.  + RSV, treated
with empiric antibiotics, palvilizumab, ribavirin and IVIG.
- ___, Bone marrow aspirate and biopsy showed a cellular
marrow by aspirate with trilineage dyspoitic maturation. By
immunohistochemistry CD34 highlights blast cells comprising less
than 5% of the overall cellularity. Cellularity in the core
biopsy is low, which may be a sampling artifact.  Cytogenetics
revealed no cells noted with the previously observed complex
abnormal karyotype with monosomy 7, deletion of 5q and other
chromosome aberrations associated with myelodysplasia with an
unfavorable prognosis.

and ATG conditioning.  D0 = ___.

and development of fevers to 103 with coagulase-negative

documents.text:
History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old female with transformed DLBCL with 
a
history of stage IIA follicular lymphoma with treatment
related MDS ___ allogeneic stem cell transplant on ___ who
presents with four days of productive cough, fevers and chills. She called her ___ clinic on ___ and reported fever,
chills, and productive cough. She had been seen at urgent care
earlier on ___ and received CXR which was consistent with
pneumonia, and she was treated with ceftriaxone 1g, steroids and
DuoNebs. She called ___ clinic due to lack of improvement. She was referred to ED for admission and IV antibiotics, given
her pneumonia and history of allogenic transplant. In the ED, her vitals were: T 98.8, HR 96, BP 129/65, RR 18, 
SPO2
97% RA. Lung exam was significant for diffuse expiratory 
wheezing
and rhonchi. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13, HGB 13, plt 256, K
4.6, Cr 1.2. She was given azithromycin, albuterol nebs, DuoNeb,
IVF. On arrival to OMED, she reports she has laryngitis and continued
cough. She has multiple sick contacts (grandchildren at home who
have colds). She denies current fever, chills, abdominal pain,
nausea, diarrhea, dysuria, leg swelling. REVIEW OF SYSTEMS:  
A complete 10-point review of systems was performed and was
negative unless otherwise noted in the HPI.
