Past Medical History:
PAST ONCOLOGIC HISTORY: 
 Transformed DLBCL with a history of follicular lymphoma stage
IIA
- ___ developed worsening musculoskeletal back pain, early
satiety, hypoalbuminemia and found to have mesenteric mass
- ?___ ex lap with 15 cm lobulated mass involving the
duodenum, retroperitoneum and celiac access. Biopsies showed
Follicular lymphomas grade II/III. Reportedly negative staging
Gallium scan. CD10+ BCL2+
- ___ completed 6 cycles CHOP, complications included
SVC/innominate thrombus (tPA)
- ___ CT showed persistent 7 x 3.5 x 9 cm oblong mass, bone
marrow at completion was negative for lymphomatous involvement. - ___ PET-CT with very slight amount of increased tracer
activity within the posterior left supraclavicular region. No
other areas of FDG avid disease were noted 
- ___ through ___ per records she was treated with CVP
followed by course of single agent Rituxan
- ___ through ___ surveillance imaging with no evidence of
recurrent disease, stable mesenteric mass. - ___ abdominal pain led to CT with no change in mass size,
increased conspicuity of nodular borders
- ___ PET-CT with L. hilar LN PET-avid to SUV 7.9, otherwise
stable mesenteric mass with low level SUV 2.2 stable since 
prior. - ___ CT torso showed persistent mesenteric and left hilar
lymphadenopathy. Stable right middle lobe small focus of ground
glass opacity and adjacent subpleural fat hypertrophy, 
suggestive
of inflammatory process. Stable right adnexal cyst. - ___ Presented to PCP ___ ___iscomfort. Exam
revealed new adenopathy. Labs notable for LDH 341, WBC 10.1,
normal differential, PLT 452. - ___ PET CT revealed, "Large left cervical,
supraclavicular, mediastinal lymphadenopathy, and 
retroperitoneal
lymphadenopathy, and small mesenteric
lymphadenopathy, all markedly FDG-avid and concerning for
lymphoma." SUVmax 35.5. - ___iopsy revealed diffuse large B cell
lymphoma, CD20+ CD10+ lambda restricted. MIB and cytogenetics 
are
pending
- ___ C1D1 ICE
- ___ C1 Rituximab, clinically improved adenopathy
- ___ C2 Rituximab, WBC 6.5, PLT 43
- ___ Admit for C2D1 ICE
- ___ C3 Rituximab
- ___ PET CT showed almost complete resolution of FDG avid
disease with a residual focus of avidity in the bed of the 
former
abdominal mass, SUV 3
- ___ C4 Rituximab
- ___ C4 ICE followed by stem cell mobilization and
collection, BMBx showed a nest of CLL unrelated to her 
aggressive
lymphoma
- ___ Presented with large DVTs, SVC filter placed
- ___ D0 of a BEAM autoSCT, course notable for mucositis
- ___ Switched to Rivaroxiban for AC
- ___ PET CT ___, PFTs with normal Hb adjusted DLCO
- ___ IVIg 400 mg/kg c/b fever, aseptic meningitis,
cytopenias
- ___ Started IFRT to paraaortic LNs, 3600 cGy total dose.

Name:  ___                   Unit No:   ___

fever, chills, cough
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
none
 
History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old female with transformed DLBCL with 
a
history of stage IIA follicular lymphoma with treatment
related MDS ___ allogeneic stem cell transplant on ___ who
presents with four days of productive cough, fevers and chills.

She called her ___ clinic on ___ and reported fever,
chills, and productive cough. She had been seen at urgent care
earlier on ___ and received CXR which was consistent with
pneumonia, and she was treated with ceftriaxone 1g, steroids and
DuoNebs. She called ___ clinic due to lack of improvement.
She was referred to ED for admission and IV antibiotics, given
her pneumonia and history of allogenic transplant.

In the ED, her vitals were: T 98.8, HR 96, BP 129/65, RR 18, 
SPO2
97% RA. Lung exam was significant for diffuse expiratory 
wheezing
and rhonchi. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13, HGB 13, plt 256, K
4.6, Cr 1.2. She was given azithromycin, albuterol nebs, DuoNeb,
IVF.

On arrival to OMED, she reports she has laryngitis and continued
cough. She has multiple sick contacts (grandchildren at home who
have colds). She denies current fever, chills, abdominal pain,
nausea, diarrhea, dysuria, leg swelling.

REVIEW OF SYSTEMS:  
A complete 10-point review of systems was performed and was
negative unless otherwise noted in the HPI.  
 
Past Medical History:
PAST ONCOLOGIC HISTORY: 
 Transformed DLBCL with a history of follicular lymphoma stage
IIA
- ___ developed worsening musculoskeletal back pain, early
satiety, hypoalbuminemia and found to have mesenteric mass
- ?___ ex lap with 15 cm lobulated mass involving the
duodenum, retroperitoneum and celiac access.  Biopsies showed
Follicular lymphomas grade II/III.  Reportedly negative staging
Gallium scan. CD10+ BCL2+
- ___ completed 6 cycles CHOP, complications included
SVC/innominate thrombus (tPA)
- ___ CT showed persistent 7 x 3.5 x 9 cm oblong mass, bone
marrow at completion was negative for lymphomatous involvement.
- ___ PET-CT with very slight amount of increased tracer
activity within the posterior left supraclavicular region. No
other areas of FDG avid disease were noted 
- ___ through ___ per records she was treated with CVP
followed by course of single agent Rituxan
- ___ through ___ surveillance imaging with no evidence of
recurrent disease, stable mesenteric mass.
- ___ abdominal pain led to CT with no change in mass size,
increased conspicuity of nodular borders
- ___ PET-CT with L. hilar LN PET-avid to SUV 7.9, otherwise
stable mesenteric mass with low level SUV 2.2 stable since 
prior.
- ___ CT torso showed persistent mesenteric and left hilar
lymphadenopathy. Stable right middle lobe small focus of ground
glass opacity and adjacent subpleural fat hypertrophy, 
suggestive
of inflammatory process. Stable right adnexal cyst.  
- ___ Presented to PCP ___ ___iscomfort. 
Exam
revealed new adenopathy. Labs notable for LDH 341, WBC 10.1,
normal differential, PLT 452. 
- ___ PET CT revealed, "Large left cervical,
supraclavicular, mediastinal lymphadenopathy, and 
retroperitoneal
lymphadenopathy, and small mesenteric
lymphadenopathy, all markedly FDG-avid and concerning for
lymphoma." SUVmax 35.5.
- ___iopsy revealed diffuse large B cell
lymphoma, CD20+ CD10+ lambda restricted. MIB and cytogenetics 
are
pending
- ___ C1D1 ICE
- ___ C1 Rituximab, clinically improved adenopathy
- ___ C2 Rituximab, WBC 6.5, PLT 43
- ___ Admit for C2D1 ICE
- ___ C3 Rituximab
- ___ PET CT showed almost complete resolution of FDG avid
disease with a residual focus of avidity in the bed of the 
former
abdominal mass, SUV 3
- ___ C4 Rituximab
- ___ C4 ICE followed by stem cell mobilization and
collection, BMBx showed a nest of CLL unrelated to her 
aggressive
lymphoma
- ___ Presented with large DVTs, SVC filter placed
- ___ D0 of a BEAM autoSCT, course notable for mucositis
- ___ Switched to Rivaroxiban for AC
- ___ PET CT ___, PFTs with normal Hb adjusted DLCO
- ___ IVIg 400 mg/kg c/b fever, aseptic meningitis,
cytopenias
- ___ Started IFRT to paraaortic LNs, 3600 cGy total dose.
- ___, Norovirus
- ___ Presented with dyspnea, DLCO 79% predicted (adjusted
for Hb). Started prednisone 80 mg PO daily and adjusted with
DLCO.  Finally d/ced ___. 
- IVIg 400 mg/kg, continues monthly for
Hypogammaglobuonemia/CVID.
- ___, CT torso with no evidence of active disease. Stable
appearance of a conglomeration of mesenteric lymph nodes. 
- ___, Right total knee replacement, complicated by foot
drop likely due to irritation of peroneal nerve from the CPM
machine, as well as a cellulitis of the right leg; same leg as
her previous DVT and her circulation is poor. 
- ___, CT Torso with no evidence of active disease. 
Stable appearance of conglomerate of mesenteric LN's. Increased
dilatation of the main pulmonary artery suggests worsening
pulmonary arterial hypertension of indeterminate etiology.
- ___, CT torso with no evidence of active disease. Increased
dilation of pulmonary artery.  Evaluated by Dr. ___
- ___, Increasing right leg swelling and shortness of breath
with noted DVT; no DVT.  Xarelto increased back to 20 mg
daily(had been decreased given age and prior chronic DVT).  No
evidence for lymphoma on CT imaging.
- ___, noted drop in blood counts. Bone marrow biopsy showed
dysplasia in all cell lines with ~ 6% blasts noted in aspirate. 
Cytogenetics showing multiple abnormalities. 
- ___, C1 Dacogen
- ___, admitted with fever in setting of neutropenia, and
increasing right sided back pain.  No infectious source found;
after consultation with ID, it was decided to treat empirically
for presumptive osteomyelitis/discitis with 6 weeks of 
vancomycin
(750mg IV q12h), cefepime (2g IV q12h), micafungin (100 mg PO
q24h).  Required short time of pain medicines for back pain. 
- ___, C2 Dacogen
- ___, admitted with increased confusion and issues of
word finding.  Head CT and MRI of the head did not show any
abnormality.  Treated with concern for meningitis and remained 
on
her other antibiotics for treatment of presumed osteomyelitis. 
Confusion resolved and no infectious etiology was noted except
for possible UTI. 
- ___, Admitted with 2 days of nausea, vomiting, fever,
confusion, and urinary incontinence, with infectious workup,
overall negative, except for positive coronavirus.  CTA negative
for PE and there was no evidence of pulmonary or abdominal
infection on imaging.  MRI of brain was negative for an
intracranial process; MRI spine was negative for abscess or
osteomyelitis. 
- ___, C3 Dacogen and discharged to home on ___.
- ___, Admitted with diarrhea, decreased appetite. 
Received IVF support, transfusions and potassium replacement;
discharged on ___. 
- ___, C4 Dacogen
- ___, Admitted with cough and wheezing.  + RSV, treated
with empiric antibiotics, palvilizumab, ribavirin and IVIG.
- ___, Bone marrow aspirate and biopsy showed a cellular
marrow by aspirate with trilineage dyspoitic maturation. By
immunohistochemistry CD34 highlights blast cells comprising less
than 5% of the overall cellularity. Cellularity in the core
biopsy is low, which may be a sampling artifact.  Cytogenetics
revealed no cells noted with the previously observed complex
abnormal karyotype with monosomy 7, deletion of 5q and other
chromosome aberrations associated with myelodysplasia with an
unfavorable prognosis.
- ___, Admitted for MUD allogeneic transplant with Flu/Bu
and ATG conditioning.  D0 = ___. 
- ___ - ___, admission for aseptic meningitis; noted CMV
viremia, on Valganciclovir.
- ___ - ___, admission for headache, nausea and vomiting
and development of fevers to 103 with coagulase-negative
gram-positive cocci noted as S. epidermidis bacteremia;
Daptomycin for total 6 week course of antibiotics(completed
___.  Also noted for new DVT's of lower legs, on Lovenox

fever, chills, cough

none
 
History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old female with transformed DLBCL with 
a
history of stage IIA follicular lymphoma with treatment
related MDS ___ allogeneic stem cell transplant on ___ who
presents with four days of productive cough, fevers and chills.

She called her ___ clinic on ___ and reported fever,
chills, and productive cough. She had been seen at urgent care
earlier on ___ and received CXR which was consistent with
pneumonia, and she was treated with ceftriaxone 1g, steroids and
DuoNebs. She called ___ clinic due to lack of improvement.
She was referred to ED for admission and IV antibiotics, given
her pneumonia and history of allogenic transplant.

In the ED, her vitals were: T 98.8, HR 96, BP 129/65, RR 18, 
SPO2
97% RA. Lung exam was significant for diffuse expiratory 
wheezing
and rhonchi. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13, HGB 13, plt 256, K
4.6, Cr 1.2. She was given azithromycin, albuterol nebs, DuoNeb,
IVF.

On arrival to OMED, she reports she has laryngitis and continued
cough. She has multiple sick contacts (grandchildren at home who
have colds). She denies current fever, chills, abdominal pain,
nausea, diarrhea, dysuria, leg swelling.

REVIEW OF SYSTEMS:  
A complete 10-point review of systems was performed and was
negative unless otherwise noted in the HPI.  
 
Past Medical History:
PAST ONCOLOGIC HISTORY: 
 Transformed DLBCL with a history of follicular lymphoma stage
IIA
- ___ developed worsening musculoskeletal back pain, early
satiety, hypoalbuminemia and found to have mesenteric mass
- ?___ ex lap with 15 cm lobulated mass involving the
duodenum, retroperitoneum and celiac access.  Biopsies showed
Follicular lymphomas grade II/III.  Reportedly negative staging
Gallium scan. CD10+ BCL2+
- ___ completed 6 cycles CHOP, complications included
SVC/innominate thrombus (tPA)
- ___ CT showed persistent 7 x 3.5 x 9 cm oblong mass, bone
marrow at completion was negative for lymphomatous involvement.
- ___ PET-CT with very slight amount of increased tracer
activity within the posterior left supraclavicular region. No
other areas of FDG avid disease were noted 
- ___ through ___ per records she was treated with CVP
followed by course of single agent Rituxan
- ___ through ___ surveillance imaging with no evidence of
recurrent disease, stable mesenteric mass.
- ___ abdominal pain led to CT with no change in mass size,
increased conspicuity of nodular borders
- ___ PET-CT with L. hilar LN PET-avid to SUV 7.9, otherwise
stable mesenteric mass with low level SUV 2.2 stable since 
prior.
- ___ CT torso showed persistent mesenteric and left hilar
lymphadenopathy. Stable right middle lobe small focus of ground
glass opacity and adjacent subpleural fat hypertrophy, 
suggestive
of inflammatory process. Stable right adnexal cyst.  
- ___ Presented to PCP ___ ___iscomfort. 
Exam
revealed new adenopathy. Labs notable for LDH 341, WBC 10.1,
normal differential, PLT 452. 
- ___ PET CT revealed, "Large left cervical,
supraclavicular, mediastinal lymphadenopathy, and 
retroperitoneal
lymphadenopathy, and small mesenteric
lymphadenopathy, all markedly FDG-avid and concerning for
lymphoma." SUVmax 35.5.
- ___iopsy revealed diffuse large B cell
lymphoma, CD20+ CD10+ lambda restricted. MIB and cytogenetics 
are
pending
- ___ C1D1 ICE
- ___ C1 Rituximab, clinically improved adenopathy
- ___ C2 Rituximab, WBC 6.5, PLT 43
- ___ Admit for C2D1 ICE
- ___ C3 Rituximab
- ___ PET CT showed almost complete resolution of FDG avid
disease with a residual focus of avidity in the bed of the 
former
abdominal mass, SUV 3
- ___ C4 Rituximab
- ___ C4 ICE followed by stem cell mobilization and
collection, BMBx showed a nest of CLL unrelated to her 
aggressive
lymphoma
- ___ Presented with large DVTs, SVC filter placed
- ___ D0 of a BEAM autoSCT, course notable for mucositis
- ___ Switched to Rivaroxiban for AC
- ___ PET CT ___, PFTs with normal Hb adjusted DLCO
- ___ IVIg 400 mg/kg c/b fever, aseptic meningitis,
cytopenias
- ___ Started IFRT to paraaortic LNs, 3600 cGy total dose.
- ___, Norovirus
- ___ Presented with dyspnea, DLCO 79% predicted (adjusted
for Hb). Started prednisone 80 mg PO daily and adjusted with
DLCO.  Finally d/ced ___. 
- IVIg 400 mg/kg, continues monthly for
Hypogammaglobuonemia/CVID.
- ___, CT torso with no evidence of active disease. Stable
appearance of a conglomeration of mesenteric lymph nodes. 
- ___, Right total knee replacement, complicated by foot
drop likely due to irritation of peroneal nerve from the CPM
machine, as well as a cellulitis of the right leg; same leg as
her previous DVT and her circulation is poor. 
- ___, CT Torso with no evidence of active disease. 
Stable appearance of conglomerate of mesenteric LN's. Increased
dilatation of the main pulmonary artery suggests worsening
pulmonary arterial hypertension of indeterminate etiology.
- ___, CT torso with no evidence of active disease. Increased
dilation of pulmonary artery.  Evaluated by Dr. ___
- ___, Increasing right leg swelling and shortness of breath
with noted DVT; no DVT.  Xarelto increased back to 20 mg
daily(had been decreased given age and prior chronic DVT).  No
evidence for lymphoma on CT imaging.
- ___, noted drop in blood counts. Bone marrow biopsy showed
dysplasia in all cell lines with ~ 6% blasts noted in aspirate. 
Cytogenetics showing multiple abnormalities. 
- ___, C1 Dacogen
- ___, admitted with fever in setting of neutropenia, and
increasing right sided back pain.  No infectious source found;
after consultation with ID, it was decided to treat empirically
for presumptive osteomyelitis/discitis with 6 weeks of 
vancomycin
(750mg IV q12h), cefepime (2g IV q12h), micafungin (100 mg PO
q24h).  Required short time of pain medicines for back pain. 
- ___, C2 Dacogen
- ___, admitted with increased confusion and issues of
word finding.  Head CT and MRI of the head did not show any
abnormality.  Treated with concern for meningitis and remained 
on
her other antibiotics for treatment of presumed osteomyelitis. 
Confusion resolved and no infectious etiology was noted except
for possible UTI. 
- ___, Admitted with 2 days of nausea, vomiting, fever,
confusion, and urinary incontinence, with infectious workup,
overall negative, except for positive coronavirus.  CTA negative
for PE and there was no evidence of pulmonary or abdominal
infection on imaging.  MRI of brain was negative for an
intracranial process; MRI spine was negative for abscess or
osteomyelitis. 
- ___, C3 Dacogen and discharged to home on ___.
- ___, Admitted with diarrhea, decreased appetite. 
Received IVF support, transfusions and potassium replacement;
discharged on ___. 
- ___, C4 Dacogen
- ___, Admitted with cough and wheezing.  + RSV, treated
with empiric antibiotics, palvilizumab, ribavirin and IVIG.
- ___, Bone marrow aspirate and biopsy showed a cellular
marrow by aspirate with trilineage dyspoitic maturation. By
immunohistochemistry CD34 highlights blast cells comprising less
than 5% of the overall cellularity. Cellularity in the core
biopsy is low, which may be a sampling artifact.  Cytogenetics
revealed no cells noted with the previously observed complex
abnormal karyotype with monosomy 7, deletion of 5q and other
chromosome aberrations associated with myelodysplasia with an
unfavorable prognosis.
- ___, Admitted for MUD allogeneic transplant with Flu/Bu
and ATG conditioning.  D0 = ___. 
- ___ - ___, admission for aseptic meningitis; noted CMV
viremia, on Valganciclovir.
- ___ - ___, admission for headache, nausea and vomiting

Daptomycin for total 6 week course of antibiotics(completed

infusion was ~1 month ago. IGG 715 this admission, so IVIG was 
not given this admission. She was monitored for signs of 
infection and treated as above.

acyclovir and Bactrim.

was treated with nystatin cream only, due to hesitancy to

History of Present Illness:
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old female with transformed DLBCL with 
a
history of stage IIA follicular lymphoma with treatment
related MDS ___ allogeneic stem cell transplant on ___ who
presents with four days of productive cough, fevers and chills.

She called her ___ clinic on ___ and reported fever,
chills, and productive cough. She had been seen at urgent care
earlier on ___ and received CXR which was consistent with
pneumonia, and she was treated with ceftriaxone 1g, steroids and
DuoNebs. She called ___ clinic due to lack of improvement.
She was referred to ED for admission and IV antibiotics, given
her pneumonia and history of allogenic transplant.

In the ED, her vitals were: T 98.8, HR 96, BP 129/65, RR 18, 
SPO2
97% RA. Lung exam was significant for diffuse expiratory 
wheezing
and rhonchi. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13, HGB 13, plt 256, K
4.6, Cr 1.2. She was given azithromycin, albuterol nebs, DuoNeb,
IVF.

On arrival to OMED, she reports she has laryngitis and continued
cough. She has multiple sick contacts (grandchildren at home who
have colds). She denies current fever, chills, abdominal pain,
nausea, diarrhea, dysuria, leg swelling.

REVIEW OF SYSTEMS:  
A complete 10-point review of systems was performed and was
negative unless otherwise noted in the HPI.  
 
Past Medical History:
PAST ONCOLOGIC HISTORY: 
 Transformed DLBCL with a history of follicular lymphoma stage
IIA
- ___ developed worsening musculoskeletal back pain, early
satiety, hypoalbuminemia and found to have mesenteric mass
- ?___ ex lap with 15 cm lobulated mass involving the
duodenum, retroperitoneum and celiac access.  Biopsies showed
Follicular lymphomas grade II/III.  Reportedly negative staging
Gallium scan. CD10+ BCL2+
- ___ completed 6 cycles CHOP, complications included
SVC/innominate thrombus (tPA)
- ___ CT showed persistent 7 x 3.5 x 9 cm oblong mass, bone
marrow at completion was negative for lymphomatous involvement.
- ___ PET-CT with very slight amount of increased tracer
activity within the posterior left supraclavicular region. No
other areas of FDG avid disease were noted 
- ___ through ___ per records she was treated with CVP
followed by course of single agent Rituxan
- ___ through ___ surveillance imaging with no evidence of
recurrent disease, stable mesenteric mass.
- ___ abdominal pain led to CT with no change in mass size,
increased conspicuity of nodular borders
- ___ PET-CT with L. hilar LN PET-avid to SUV 7.9, otherwise
stable mesenteric mass with low level SUV 2.2 stable since 
prior.
- ___ CT torso showed persistent mesenteric and left hilar
lymphadenopathy. Stable right middle lobe small focus of ground
glass opacity and adjacent subpleural fat hypertrophy, 
suggestive
of inflammatory process. Stable right adnexal cyst.  
- ___ Presented to PCP ___ ___iscomfort. 
Exam
revealed new adenopathy. Labs notable for LDH 341, WBC 10.1,
normal differential, PLT 452. 
- ___ PET CT revealed, "Large left cervical,
supraclavicular, mediastinal lymphadenopathy, and 
retroperitoneal
lymphadenopathy, and small mesenteric
lymphadenopathy, all markedly FDG-avid and concerning for
lymphoma." SUVmax 35.5.
- ___iopsy revealed diffuse large B cell
lymphoma, CD20+ CD10+ lambda restricted. MIB and cytogenetics 
are
pending
- ___ C1D1 ICE
- ___ C1 Rituximab, clinically improved adenopathy
- ___ C2 Rituximab, WBC 6.5, PLT 43
- ___ Admit for C2D1 ICE
- ___ C3 Rituximab
- ___ PET CT showed almost complete resolution of FDG avid
disease with a residual focus of avidity in the bed of the 
former
abdominal mass, SUV 3
- ___ C4 Rituximab
- ___ C4 ICE followed by stem cell mobilization and
collection, BMBx showed a nest of CLL unrelated to her 
aggressive
lymphoma
- ___ Presented with large DVTs, SVC filter placed
- ___ D0 of a BEAM autoSCT, course notable for mucositis
- ___ Switched to Rivaroxiban for AC
- ___ PET CT ___, PFTs with normal Hb adjusted DLCO
- ___ IVIg 400 mg/kg c/b fever, aseptic meningitis,
cytopenias
- ___ Started IFRT to paraaortic LNs, 3600 cGy total dose.
- ___, Norovirus
- ___ Presented with dyspnea, DLCO 79% predicted (adjusted
for Hb). Started prednisone 80 mg PO daily and adjusted with
DLCO.  Finally d/ced ___. 
- IVIg 400 mg/kg, continues monthly for
Hypogammaglobuonemia/CVID.
- ___, CT torso with no evidence of active disease. Stable
appearance of a conglomeration of mesenteric lymph nodes. 
- ___, Right total knee replacement, complicated by foot
drop likely due to irritation of peroneal nerve from the CPM
machine, as well as a cellulitis of the right leg; same leg as
her previous DVT and her circulation is poor. 
- ___, CT Torso with no evidence of active disease. 
Stable appearance of conglomerate of mesenteric LN's. Increased
dilatation of the main pulmonary artery suggests worsening
pulmonary arterial hypertension of indeterminate etiology.
- ___, CT torso with no evidence of active disease. Increased
dilation of pulmonary artery.  Evaluated by Dr. ___
- ___, Increasing right leg swelling and shortness of breath
with noted DVT; no DVT.  Xarelto increased back to 20 mg
daily(had been decreased given age and prior chronic DVT).  No
evidence for lymphoma on CT imaging.
- ___, noted drop in blood counts. Bone marrow biopsy showed
dysplasia in all cell lines with ~ 6% blasts noted in aspirate. 
Cytogenetics showing multiple abnormalities. 
- ___, C1 Dacogen
- ___, admitted with fever in setting of neutropenia, and
increasing right sided back pain.  No infectious source found;
after consultation with ID, it was decided to treat empirically
for presumptive osteomyelitis/discitis with 6 weeks of 
vancomycin
(750mg IV q12h), cefepime (2g IV q12h), micafungin (100 mg PO
q24h).  Required short time of pain medicines for back pain. 
- ___, C2 Dacogen

word finding.  Head CT and MRI of the head did not show any
abnormality.  Treated with concern for meningitis and remained 
on
her other antibiotics for treatment of presumed osteomyelitis. 
Confusion resolved and no infectious etiology was noted except
for possible UTI. 
- ___, Admitted with 2 days of nausea, vomiting, fever,
confusion, and urinary incontinence, with infectious workup,
overall negative, except for positive coronavirus.  CTA negative
for PE and there was no evidence of pulmonary or abdominal
infection on imaging.  MRI of brain was negative for an
intracranial process; MRI spine was negative for abscess or
osteomyelitis. 
- ___, C3 Dacogen and discharged to home on ___.

discharged on ___. 
- ___, C4 Dacogen
- ___, Admitted with cough and wheezing.  + RSV, treated
with empiric antibiotics, palvilizumab, ribavirin and IVIG.
- ___, Bone marrow aspirate and biopsy showed a cellular
marrow by aspirate with trilineage dyspoitic maturation. By
immunohistochemistry CD34 highlights blast cells comprising less
than 5% of the overall cellularity. Cellularity in the core
biopsy is low, which may be a sampling artifact.  Cytogenetics
revealed no cells noted with the previously observed complex
abnormal karyotype with monosomy 7, deletion of 5q and other
chromosome aberrations associated with myelodysplasia with an
unfavorable prognosis.
- ___, Admitted for MUD allogeneic transplant with Flu/Bu
and ATG conditioning.  D0 = ___. 
- ___ - ___, admission for aseptic meningitis; noted CMV
viremia, on Valganciclovir.
- ___ - ___, admission for headache, nausea and vomiting
and development of fevers to 103 with coagulase-negative
gram-positive cocci noted as S. epidermidis bacteremia;
Daptomycin for total 6 week course of antibiotics(completed
___.  Also noted for new DVT's of lower legs, on Lovenox
BID. 
- ___, admission for increased rash and diarrhea. 
Started increased systemic steroids and now tapered.

ACTIVE ISSUES:

#community acquired pneumonia 
Most likely etiology is community acquired pneumonia, given 
absence of consolidation on CXR, her sick contacts (grandkids 
with colds), and lung exam with bronchial breath sounds and

respiratory screen was negative. Given her immunocompromised 
state, will treat for CAP. D1 CTX ___, D1 azithromycin ___. 
Her symptoms were treated with DuonNebs, Flovent, albuterol, and 
guafenisen. We discharged her home with lovenox to complete a 5 
day course of antibiotics ending on ___

#CVID
Receives IVIG every 1 - 2 months to keep IGG > 500. Her last 
infusion was ~1 month ago. IGG 715 this admission, so IVIG was 
not given this admission. She was monitored for signs of 
infection and treated as above.

home prednisone and MMF were continued, as well as her home 
acyclovir and Bactrim.

Has required 5-day course of fluconazole in past to resolve. She 
was treated with nystatin cream only, due to hesitancy to 
prescribe a systemic antifungal with other QTc prolonging meds 
(azithro).

rivaroxaban.

carotid cavernous sinus aneurysm; coil placed in the aneurysm

issues,
Ms. ___ was admitted on ___ for her MUD allogeneic

allogeneic transplantation course was complicated by aseptic
menigitis, CMV viremia, S. epidermidis bacteremia, DVT's of 
lower
legs, and GVDH. 

She was last seen outpatient on ___. During this visit, 
she did not have any URI symptoms. She reported using her
inhalers as needed only. She noted some diarrhea and vomiting
which persisted for several days and then stopped. Overall, she
reported feeling well without sick contacts. 

Since the visit on ___, she reported that the several days 
(4
days ago), she was more fatigue, had mild sore throat, and had
exposure to sick contacts with URI symptoms. She noted increased
cough and wheezing but this improved somewhat with inhaler and 
so
she felt she was improving. However, on ___, she
started feeling unwell again. On ___, she visited a
local urgent care and was found to have a fever of 100.7. At 
this
point, she was coughing more with increased wheezing and 
fatigue.

In addition, she noticed a headache (somewhat typical of her
migraines) that wrapped around her head like a "C". The headache
started from the back of the head and progressed into the 
frontal
part of her head. She did not notice any visual disturbances,
lightheadedness, or dizziness. The headache appeared to be worse
with increased cough but was not associated with visual
disturbances, nausea, or vomiting. Her appetite has diminished
significantly - she did eat or drink adequately for almost the
past 48 hours. The provider at the urgent care advised her to
come to the ED and so she called the ___ fellow who directed her
to the ___ ED. 

In the ED, her initial vitals were: T 99-100.2, HR 104-103, BP
114-134/52-66, RR ___, SPO2 95-97% RA. Lung examination was
significant for loud audible cough, diffuse wheezing, and
crackles. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13.4, HGB 12.9, plt 229, 
Cr 1.3 and lactate 1.1. Flu negative. She was given albuterol
nebs, DuoNeb, and IVF. CXR showed RLL opacity c/f pneumonia. 
Given CXR findings, she was given cefepime IV and vancomycin IV. 

She was also noted to have increased 02 requirement (RA on
initial ED visit then became hypoxic, ___ via NC). This 
prompted
CTA CHEST  (given DVT hx) but fortunately, CT chest did not show
evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic abnormality but did
reveal consolidation in nodular opacities with perihilar and
peripheral consolidation and surrounding ground glass which are
most severe in the right lower and upper lobe with additional
findings in the left lower lobe. 
 
On arrival to ___ unit, she reported that her cough and wheezing
is still profound. No sore throat, headache or night sweats. She
denies chills, rigors, abdominal pain, nausea, diarrhea, 
dysuria,
hematuria, leg swelling. No rash in her groin area but does have
multiple creams prescribed by dermatology due to various skin
rashes and GVHD. Erythema of right shin improved per patient
report - reported injury to RLE ~ 6 weeks ago that appears to
have no healed completely - no worsening erythema or
pain/discharge. Usual numbness of right toes following prior
surgery; has noted some increased sensations on the bottom of 
his
feet.

documents.text:
History of Present Illness:
A ___ year old female with CVID,
history of follicular lymphoma transformed to DLBCL status post
autolgous SCT in ___ (in remission from lymphoma) but noted for
treatment related MDS status post 4 cycles of Decitabine (C4 D1 
=
___ with plans to move toward allogeneic transplant but
developed productive cough of clear sputum and wheezing for 2
days in ___ and was found to have RSV. She was then
treated with palvilizumab on ___ and ribavirin 600mg q 8h
from ___. She received IVIG 10 grams daily for 4
days from ___. She required a tooth extraction on
the lower left side on ___ due to persistent tooth pain. Following recovery of her respiratory symptoms and dental 
issues,
Ms. ___ was admitted on ___ for her MUD allogeneic
transplant with Fludarabine, Busulfan and ATG conditioning. Her
allogeneic transplantation course was complicated by aseptic
menigitis, CMV viremia, S. epidermidis bacteremia, DVT's of 
lower
legs, and GVDH. She was last seen outpatient on ___. During this visit, 
she did not have any URI symptoms. She reported using her
inhalers as needed only. She noted some diarrhea and vomiting
which persisted for several days and then stopped. Overall, she
reported feeling well without sick contacts. Since the visit on ___, she reported that the several days 
(4
days ago), she was more fatigue, had mild sore throat, and had
exposure to sick contacts with URI symptoms. She noted increased
cough and wheezing but this improved somewhat with inhaler and 
so
she felt she was improving. However, on ___, she
started feeling unwell again. On ___, she visited a
local urgent care and was found to have a fever of 100.7. At 
this
point, she was coughing more with increased wheezing and 
fatigue. In addition, she noticed a headache (somewhat typical of her
migraines) that wrapped around her head like a "C". The headache
started from the back of the head and progressed into the 
frontal
part of her head. She did not notice any visual disturbances,
lightheadedness, or dizziness. The headache appeared to be worse
with increased cough but was not associated with visual
disturbances, nausea, or vomiting. Her appetite has diminished
significantly - she did eat or drink adequately for almost the
past 48 hours. The provider at the urgent care advised her to
come to the ED and so she called the ___ fellow who directed her
to the ___ ED. In the ED, her initial vitals were: T 99-100.2, HR 104-103, BP
114-134/52-66, RR ___, SPO2 95-97% RA. Lung examination was
significant for loud audible cough, diffuse wheezing, and
crackles. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13.4, HGB 12.9, plt 229, 
Cr 1.3 and lactate 1.1. Flu negative. She was given albuterol
nebs, DuoNeb, and IVF. CXR showed RLL opacity c/f pneumonia.

documents.text:
The provider at the urgent care advised her to
come to the ED and so she called the ___ fellow who directed her
to the ___ ED. In the ED, her initial vitals were: T 99-100.2, HR 104-103, BP
114-134/52-66, RR ___, SPO2 95-97% RA. Lung examination was
significant for loud audible cough, diffuse wheezing, and
crackles. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13.4, HGB 12.9, plt 229, 
Cr 1.3 and lactate 1.1. Flu negative. She was given albuterol
nebs, DuoNeb, and IVF. CXR showed RLL opacity c/f pneumonia. Given CXR findings, she was given cefepime IV and vancomycin IV. She was also noted to have increased 02 requirement (RA on
initial ED visit then became hypoxic, ___ via NC). This 
prompted
CTA CHEST  (given DVT hx) but fortunately, CT chest did not show
evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic abnormality but did
reveal consolidation in nodular opacities with perihilar and
peripheral consolidation and surrounding ground glass which are
most severe in the right lower and upper lobe with additional
findings in the left lower lobe. On arrival to ___ unit, she reported that her cough and wheezing
is still profound. No sore throat, headache or night sweats. She
denies chills, rigors, abdominal pain, nausea, diarrhea, 
dysuria,
hematuria, leg swelling. No rash in her groin area but does have
multiple creams prescribed by dermatology due to various skin
rashes and GVHD. Erythema of right shin improved per patient
report - reported injury to RLE ~ 6 weeks ago that appears to
have no healed completely - no worsening erythema or
pain/discharge. Usual numbness of right toes following prior
surgery; has noted some increased sensations on the bottom of 
his
feet.

Name:  ___                   Unit No:   ___

Service: MEDICINE

dapsone

fever, cough, headache

None

 
History of Present Illness:
A ___ year old female with CVID,
history of follicular lymphoma transformed to DLBCL status post
autolgous SCT in ___ (in remission from lymphoma) but noted for
treatment related MDS status post 4 cycles of Decitabine (C4 D1 
=
___ with plans to move toward allogeneic transplant but
developed productive cough of clear sputum and wheezing for 2
days in ___ and was found to have RSV. She was then
treated with palvilizumab on ___ and ribavirin 600mg q 8h
from ___. She received IVIG 10 grams daily for 4
days from ___. She required a tooth extraction on
the lower left side on ___ due to persistent tooth pain.

Following recovery of her respiratory symptoms and dental 
issues,
Ms. ___ was admitted on ___ for her MUD allogeneic
transplant with Fludarabine, Busulfan and ATG conditioning. Her
allogeneic transplantation course was complicated by aseptic
menigitis, CMV viremia, S. epidermidis bacteremia, DVT's of 
lower
legs, and GVDH. 

She was last seen outpatient on ___. During this visit, 
she did not have any URI symptoms. She reported using her
inhalers as needed only. She noted some diarrhea and vomiting
which persisted for several days and then stopped. Overall, she
reported feeling well without sick contacts. 

Since the visit on ___, she reported that the several days 
(4
days ago), she was more fatigue, had mild sore throat, and had
exposure to sick contacts with URI symptoms. She noted increased
cough and wheezing but this improved somewhat with inhaler and 
so
she felt she was improving. However, on ___, she
started feeling unwell again. On ___, she visited a
local urgent care and was found to have a fever of 100.7. At 
this
point, she was coughing more with increased wheezing and 
fatigue.

In addition, she noticed a headache (somewhat typical of her
migraines) that wrapped around her head like a "C". The headache
started from the back of the head and progressed into the 
frontal
part of her head. She did not notice any visual disturbances,
lightheadedness, or dizziness. The headache appeared to be worse
with increased cough but was not associated with visual
disturbances, nausea, or vomiting. Her appetite has diminished
significantly - she did eat or drink adequately for almost the
past 48 hours. The provider at the urgent care advised her to
come to the ED and so she called the ___ fellow who directed her
to the ___ ED. 

In the ED, her initial vitals were: T 99-100.2, HR 104-103, BP
114-134/52-66, RR ___, SPO2 95-97% RA. Lung examination was
significant for loud audible cough, diffuse wheezing, and
crackles. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13.4, HGB 12.9, plt 229, 
Cr 1.3 and lactate 1.1. Flu negative. She was given albuterol
nebs, DuoNeb, and IVF. CXR showed RLL opacity c/f pneumonia. 
Given CXR findings, she was given cefepime IV and vancomycin IV. 

She was also noted to have increased 02 requirement (RA on
initial ED visit then became hypoxic, ___ via NC). This 
prompted
CTA CHEST  (given DVT hx) but fortunately, CT chest did not show
evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic abnormality but did
reveal consolidation in nodular opacities with perihilar and
peripheral consolidation and surrounding ground glass which are
most severe in the right lower and upper lobe with additional
findings in the left lower lobe. 
 
On arrival to ___ unit, she reported that her cough and wheezing
is still profound. No sore throat, headache or night sweats. She
denies chills, rigors, abdominal pain, nausea, diarrhea, 
dysuria,
hematuria, leg swelling. No rash in her groin area but does have
multiple creams prescribed by dermatology due to various skin
rashes and GVHD. Erythema of right shin improved per patient
report - reported injury to RLE ~ 6 weeks ago that appears to
have no healed completely - no worsening erythema or
pain/discharge. Usual numbness of right toes following prior
surgery; has noted some increased sensations on the bottom of 
his
feet.

from ___. She received IVIG 10 grams daily for 4

issues,
Ms. ___ was admitted on ___ for her MUD allogeneic

allogeneic transplantation course was complicated by aseptic
menigitis, CMV viremia, S. epidermidis bacteremia, DVT's of 
lower
legs, and GVDH. 

She was last seen outpatient on ___. During this visit, 
she did not have any URI symptoms. She reported using her
inhalers as needed only. She noted some diarrhea and vomiting
which persisted for several days and then stopped. Overall, she
reported feeling well without sick contacts. 

Since the visit on ___, she reported that the several days 
(4
days ago), she was more fatigue, had mild sore throat, and had
exposure to sick contacts with URI symptoms. She noted increased
cough and wheezing but this improved somewhat with inhaler and 
so
she felt she was improving. However, on ___, she
started feeling unwell again. On ___, she visited a
local urgent care and was found to have a fever of 100.7. At 
this
point, she was coughing more with increased wheezing and 
fatigue.

In addition, she noticed a headache (somewhat typical of her
migraines) that wrapped around her head like a "C". The headache
started from the back of the head and progressed into the 
frontal
part of her head. She did not notice any visual disturbances,
lightheadedness, or dizziness. The headache appeared to be worse
with increased cough but was not associated with visual
disturbances, nausea, or vomiting. Her appetite has diminished
significantly - she did eat or drink adequately for almost the
past 48 hours. The provider at the urgent care advised her to
come to the ED and so she called the ___ fellow who directed her
to the ___ ED.

114-134/52-66, RR ___, SPO2 95-97% RA. Lung examination was
significant for loud audible cough, diffuse wheezing, and
crackles. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13.4, HGB 12.9, plt 229,

nebs, DuoNeb, and IVF. CXR showed RLL opacity c/f pneumonia. 
Given CXR findings, she was given cefepime IV and vancomycin IV.

findings in the left lower lobe.

Name:  ___                   Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
dapsone
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
fever, cough, headache
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None

 
History of Present Illness:
A ___ year old female with CVID,
history of follicular lymphoma transformed to DLBCL status post
autolgous SCT in ___ (in remission from lymphoma) but noted for
treatment related MDS status post 4 cycles of Decitabine (C4 D1 
=
___ with plans to move toward allogeneic transplant but
developed productive cough of clear sputum and wheezing for 2
days in ___ and was found to have RSV. She was then
treated with palvilizumab on ___ and ribavirin 600mg q 8h
from ___. She received IVIG 10 grams daily for 4
days from ___. She required a tooth extraction on
the lower left side on ___ due to persistent tooth pain.

Following recovery of her respiratory symptoms and dental 
issues,
Ms. ___ was admitted on ___ for her MUD allogeneic
transplant with Fludarabine, Busulfan and ATG conditioning. Her
allogeneic transplantation course was complicated by aseptic
menigitis, CMV viremia, S. epidermidis bacteremia, DVT's of 
lower
legs, and GVDH. 

She was last seen outpatient on ___. During this visit, 
she did not have any URI symptoms. She reported using her
inhalers as needed only. She noted some diarrhea and vomiting
which persisted for several days and then stopped. Overall, she
reported feeling well without sick contacts. 

Since the visit on ___, she reported that the several days 
(4
days ago), she was more fatigue, had mild sore throat, and had
exposure to sick contacts with URI symptoms. She noted increased
cough and wheezing but this improved somewhat with inhaler and 
so
she felt she was improving. However, on ___, she
started feeling unwell again. On ___, she visited a
local urgent care and was found to have a fever of 100.7. At 
this
point, she was coughing more with increased wheezing and 
fatigue.

In addition, she noticed a headache (somewhat typical of her
migraines) that wrapped around her head like a "C". The headache
started from the back of the head and progressed into the 
frontal
part of her head. She did not notice any visual disturbances,
lightheadedness, or dizziness. The headache appeared to be worse
with increased cough but was not associated with visual
disturbances, nausea, or vomiting. Her appetite has diminished
significantly - she did eat or drink adequately for almost the
past 48 hours. The provider at the urgent care advised her to
come to the ED and so she called the ___ fellow who directed her
to the ___ ED. 

In the ED, her initial vitals were: T 99-100.2, HR 104-103, BP
114-134/52-66, RR ___, SPO2 95-97% RA. Lung examination was
significant for loud audible cough, diffuse wheezing, and
crackles. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13.4, HGB 12.9, plt 229, 
Cr 1.3 and lactate 1.1. Flu negative. She was given albuterol
nebs, DuoNeb, and IVF. CXR showed RLL opacity c/f pneumonia. 
Given CXR findings, she was given cefepime IV and vancomycin IV. 

She was also noted to have increased 02 requirement (RA on
initial ED visit then became hypoxic, ___ via NC). This 
prompted
CTA CHEST  (given DVT hx) but fortunately, CT chest did not show
evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic abnormality but did
reveal consolidation in nodular opacities with perihilar and
peripheral consolidation and surrounding ground glass which are
most severe in the right lower and upper lobe with additional
findings in the left lower lobe. 
 
On arrival to ___ unit, she reported that her cough and wheezing
is still profound. No sore throat, headache or night sweats. She
denies chills, rigors, abdominal pain, nausea, diarrhea, 
dysuria,
hematuria, leg swelling. No rash in her groin area but does have
multiple creams prescribed by dermatology due to various skin
rashes and GVHD. Erythema of right shin improved per patient
report - reported injury to RLE ~ 6 weeks ago that appears to
have no healed completely - no worsening erythema or
pain/discharge. Usual numbness of right toes following prior
surgery; has noted some increased sensations on the bottom of 
his
feet.  

 
Past Medical History:
TRANSPLANT DATA (PER OMR)
===================================
Transplant Date: ___
Graft: URD
Conditioning Intensity: Reduced-Intensity

1
red cell transfusion and 2 platelet transfusions during her

___.

and vomiting and was admitted with concern for meningitis.

Name:  ___                   Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
dapsone
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
fever, cough, headache
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None

 
History of Present Illness:
A ___ year old female with CVID,
history of follicular lymphoma transformed to DLBCL status post
autolgous SCT in ___ (in remission from lymphoma) but noted for
treatment related MDS status post 4 cycles of Decitabine (C4 D1 
=
___ with plans to move toward allogeneic transplant but
developed productive cough of clear sputum and wheezing for 2
days in ___ and was found to have RSV. She was then
treated with palvilizumab on ___ and ribavirin 600mg q 8h
from ___. She received IVIG 10 grams daily for 4
days from ___. She required a tooth extraction on
the lower left side on ___ due to persistent tooth pain.

Following recovery of her respiratory symptoms and dental 
issues,
Ms. ___ was admitted on ___ for her MUD allogeneic
transplant with Fludarabine, Busulfan and ATG conditioning. Her
allogeneic transplantation course was complicated by aseptic
menigitis, CMV viremia, S. epidermidis bacteremia, DVT's of 
lower
legs, and GVDH. 

She was last seen outpatient on ___. During this visit, 
she did not have any URI symptoms. She reported using her
inhalers as needed only. She noted some diarrhea and vomiting
which persisted for several days and then stopped. Overall, she
reported feeling well without sick contacts. 

Since the visit on ___, she reported that the several days 
(4
days ago), she was more fatigue, had mild sore throat, and had
exposure to sick contacts with URI symptoms. She noted increased
cough and wheezing but this improved somewhat with inhaler and 
so
she felt she was improving. However, on ___, she
started feeling unwell again. On ___, she visited a
local urgent care and was found to have a fever of 100.7. At 
this
point, she was coughing more with increased wheezing and 
fatigue.

In addition, she noticed a headache (somewhat typical of her
migraines) that wrapped around her head like a "C". The headache
started from the back of the head and progressed into the 
frontal
part of her head. She did not notice any visual disturbances,
lightheadedness, or dizziness. The headache appeared to be worse
with increased cough but was not associated with visual
disturbances, nausea, or vomiting. Her appetite has diminished
significantly - she did eat or drink adequately for almost the
past 48 hours. The provider at the urgent care advised her to
come to the ED and so she called the ___ fellow who directed her
to the ___ ED. 

In the ED, her initial vitals were: T 99-100.2, HR 104-103, BP
114-134/52-66, RR ___, SPO2 95-97% RA. Lung examination was
significant for loud audible cough, diffuse wheezing, and
crackles. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13.4, HGB 12.9, plt 229, 
Cr 1.3 and lactate 1.1. Flu negative. She was given albuterol
nebs, DuoNeb, and IVF. CXR showed RLL opacity c/f pneumonia. 
Given CXR findings, she was given cefepime IV and vancomycin IV. 

She was also noted to have increased 02 requirement (RA on
initial ED visit then became hypoxic, ___ via NC). This 
prompted
CTA CHEST  (given DVT hx) but fortunately, CT chest did not show
evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic abnormality but did
reveal consolidation in nodular opacities with perihilar and
peripheral consolidation and surrounding ground glass which are
most severe in the right lower and upper lobe with additional
findings in the left lower lobe. 
 
On arrival to ___ unit, she reported that her cough and wheezing
is still profound. No sore throat, headache or night sweats. She
denies chills, rigors, abdominal pain, nausea, diarrhea, 
dysuria,
hematuria, leg swelling. No rash in her groin area but does have
multiple creams prescribed by dermatology due to various skin
rashes and GVHD. Erythema of right shin improved per patient
report - reported injury to RLE ~ 6 weeks ago that appears to
have no healed completely - no worsening erythema or
pain/discharge. Usual numbness of right toes following prior
surgery; has noted some increased sensations on the bottom of 
his
feet.  

 
Past Medical History:
TRANSPLANT DATA (PER OMR)
===================================
Transplant Date: ___
Graft: URD
Conditioning Intensity: Reduced-Intensity
Conditioning Regimen: Flu/Bu/ATG
Donor Info: ___ CMV(+), ABO: Opos
Recipient Info: CMV(+), ABO: Opos    

POST TRANSPLANT COURSE (PER OMR)
==================================== 
*D0 = ___. Had expected reactions to ATG with some fluid
overload issues and given diuresis with Lasix. Creatinine
increased slightly in this setting. No ongoing fevers. Required 
1
red cell transfusion and 2 platelet transfusions during her
admission. Has history of prior DVT's(has filter in place) and
anticoagulation was switched to Lovenox. Discharged on 
___.

*Doing well and was transitioned to home. She had periodic loose
stools, felt more related to medications and not GVHD.
 
___, presented to the emergency room with headache, 
fevers,
and vomiting and was admitted with concern for meningitis.
Treated initially with cefepime and acyclovir to cover both
bacterial meningitis and HSV meningitis. LP on ___ was
consistent with aseptic meningitis and no HSV was found in the
CSF; IV antibiotics discontinued. Extensive workup for VZV, EBV,
HSV, HHV6, adenovirus, arbovirus, TB, Anaplasma and serum
toxoplasmosis was negative. Symptoms improved over time. 

*Noted for CMV viremia and started IV ganciclovir on ___
which was transitioned to oral valganciclovir prior to 
discharge.
CMV VL has been negative since ___ and her Valganciclovir
was switched to maintenance dosing, and then discontinued
(switched back to Acyclovir).  

___ - ___, Admission with headache, nausea and vomiting
and development of fevers to 103 with coagulase-negative
gram-positive cocci in blood cultures noted as S. epidermidis
bacteremia. Headache resolved on own with MRI of head from ___
unremarkable. CMV, EBV, HSV, HHV6, adeno, ___, 
arboviruses,
Lyme, crypotococcus, and fungal markers were all negative. 
Treated with antibiotics which were narrowed to vancomycin with
noted S. epidermidis bacteremia. No other sources of infection
were noted. A TTE revealed normal biventricular cavity sizes 
with
mild global left ventricular hypokinesis, mild mitral
regurgitation with normal valve morphology and trace aortic
regurgitation with normal valve morphology. No TEE as it would
not change the course of therapy. Continued on Vancomycin until
___ and was transitioned to Daptomycin as Vancomycin 
levels
fluctuated frequently throughout her hospitalization. Complete 6
weeks of antibiotics therapy with Daptomycin until ___
with vanco locks in attempt to save her port. POC pulled on
___ and continued Daptomycin peripherally until PICC 
placed
on ___.  Daptomycin course completed on ___
as planned; PICC line removed.
  
*URI with prolonged cough in ___. + Enterovirus noted on
viral PCR testing. Symptoms slowly improved.
 
*Increased rash on face and torso; tried steroid creams.

___ - ___, admitted with diarrhea and worsening rash.
Diarrhea resolved without intervention. Started on increased
steroids with improvement in rash. Discharged on Prednisone 80 
mg
daily which is now being tapered, currently on 7.5 mg daily.

___, Rituxan for GVHD (muscle cramping) x 1 dose. Added
in CellCept to try and taper other medications.

___ - ___, Admitted with four days of productive cough,
fevers and chills consistent with community acquired pneumonia;
treated with antibiotics.

PAST ONCOLOGIC HISTORY (PER OMR)

Follicular lymphomas grade II/III.  Reportedly negative staging

lymphadenopathy, and small mesenteric

pending

Hypogammaglobuonemia/CVID.

History of Present Illness:
A ___ year old female with CVID,
history of follicular lymphoma transformed to DLBCL status post
autolgous SCT in ___ (in remission from lymphoma) but noted for
treatment related MDS status post 4 cycles of Decitabine (C4 D1 
=
___ with plans to move toward allogeneic transplant but
developed productive cough of clear sputum and wheezing for 2
days in ___ and was found to have RSV. She was then
treated with palvilizumab on ___ and ribavirin 600mg q 8h
from ___. She received IVIG 10 grams daily for 4
days from ___. She required a tooth extraction on
the lower left side on ___ due to persistent tooth pain.

Following recovery of her respiratory symptoms and dental 
issues,
Ms. ___ was admitted on ___ for her MUD allogeneic
transplant with Fludarabine, Busulfan and ATG conditioning. Her
allogeneic transplantation course was complicated by aseptic
menigitis, CMV viremia, S. epidermidis bacteremia, DVT's of 
lower
legs, and GVDH. 

She was last seen outpatient on ___. During this visit, 
she did not have any URI symptoms. She reported using her
inhalers as needed only. She noted some diarrhea and vomiting
which persisted for several days and then stopped. Overall, she
reported feeling well without sick contacts. 

Since the visit on ___, she reported that the several days 
(4
days ago), she was more fatigue, had mild sore throat, and had
exposure to sick contacts with URI symptoms. She noted increased
cough and wheezing but this improved somewhat with inhaler and 
so
she felt she was improving. However, on ___, she
started feeling unwell again. On ___, she visited a
local urgent care and was found to have a fever of 100.7. At 
this
point, she was coughing more with increased wheezing and 
fatigue.

In addition, she noticed a headache (somewhat typical of her
migraines) that wrapped around her head like a "C". The headache
started from the back of the head and progressed into the 
frontal
part of her head. She did not notice any visual disturbances,
lightheadedness, or dizziness. The headache appeared to be worse
with increased cough but was not associated with visual
disturbances, nausea, or vomiting. Her appetite has diminished
significantly - she did eat or drink adequately for almost the
past 48 hours. The provider at the urgent care advised her to
come to the ED and so she called the ___ fellow who directed her
to the ___ ED. 

In the ED, her initial vitals were: T 99-100.2, HR 104-103, BP
114-134/52-66, RR ___, SPO2 95-97% RA. Lung examination was
significant for loud audible cough, diffuse wheezing, and
crackles. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13.4, HGB 12.9, plt 229, 
Cr 1.3 and lactate 1.1. Flu negative. She was given albuterol
nebs, DuoNeb, and IVF. CXR showed RLL opacity c/f pneumonia. 
Given CXR findings, she was given cefepime IV and vancomycin IV. 

She was also noted to have increased 02 requirement (RA on
initial ED visit then became hypoxic, ___ via NC). This 
prompted
CTA CHEST  (given DVT hx) but fortunately, CT chest did not show
evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic abnormality but did
reveal consolidation in nodular opacities with perihilar and
peripheral consolidation and surrounding ground glass which are
most severe in the right lower and upper lobe with additional
findings in the left lower lobe. 
 
On arrival to ___ unit, she reported that her cough and wheezing
is still profound. No sore throat, headache or night sweats. She
denies chills, rigors, abdominal pain, nausea, diarrhea, 
dysuria,
hematuria, leg swelling. No rash in her groin area but does have
multiple creams prescribed by dermatology due to various skin
rashes and GVHD. Erythema of right shin improved per patient
report - reported injury to RLE ~ 6 weeks ago that appears to
have no healed completely - no worsening erythema or
pain/discharge. Usual numbness of right toes following prior
surgery; has noted some increased sensations on the bottom of 
his
feet.

Name:  ___                   Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   F
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
dapsone
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
fever, cough, headache
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
None

 
History of Present Illness:
A ___ year old female with CVID,
history of follicular lymphoma transformed to DLBCL status post
autolgous SCT in ___ (in remission from lymphoma) but noted for
treatment related MDS status post 4 cycles of Decitabine (C4 D1 
=
___ with plans to move toward allogeneic transplant but
developed productive cough of clear sputum and wheezing for 2
days in ___ and was found to have RSV. She was then
treated with palvilizumab on ___ and ribavirin 600mg q 8h
from ___. She received IVIG 10 grams daily for 4
days from ___. She required a tooth extraction on
the lower left side on ___ due to persistent tooth pain.

Following recovery of her respiratory symptoms and dental 
issues,
Ms. ___ was admitted on ___ for her MUD allogeneic
transplant with Fludarabine, Busulfan and ATG conditioning. Her
allogeneic transplantation course was complicated by aseptic
menigitis, CMV viremia, S. epidermidis bacteremia, DVT's of 
lower
legs, and GVDH. 

She was last seen outpatient on ___. During this visit, 
she did not have any URI symptoms. She reported using her
inhalers as needed only. She noted some diarrhea and vomiting
which persisted for several days and then stopped. Overall, she
reported feeling well without sick contacts. 

Since the visit on ___, she reported that the several days 
(4
days ago), she was more fatigue, had mild sore throat, and had
exposure to sick contacts with URI symptoms. She noted increased
cough and wheezing but this improved somewhat with inhaler and 
so
she felt she was improving. However, on ___, she
started feeling unwell again. On ___, she visited a
local urgent care and was found to have a fever of 100.7. At 
this
point, she was coughing more with increased wheezing and 
fatigue.

In addition, she noticed a headache (somewhat typical of her
migraines) that wrapped around her head like a "C". The headache
started from the back of the head and progressed into the 
frontal
part of her head. She did not notice any visual disturbances,
lightheadedness, or dizziness. The headache appeared to be worse
with increased cough but was not associated with visual
disturbances, nausea, or vomiting. Her appetite has diminished
significantly - she did eat or drink adequately for almost the
past 48 hours. The provider at the urgent care advised her to
come to the ED and so she called the ___ fellow who directed her
to the ___ ED. 

In the ED, her initial vitals were: T 99-100.2, HR 104-103, BP
114-134/52-66, RR ___, SPO2 95-97% RA. Lung examination was
significant for loud audible cough, diffuse wheezing, and
crackles. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13.4, HGB 12.9, plt 229, 
Cr 1.3 and lactate 1.1. Flu negative. She was given albuterol
nebs, DuoNeb, and IVF. CXR showed RLL opacity c/f pneumonia. 
Given CXR findings, she was given cefepime IV and vancomycin IV. 

She was also noted to have increased 02 requirement (RA on
initial ED visit then became hypoxic, ___ via NC). This 
prompted
CTA CHEST  (given DVT hx) but fortunately, CT chest did not show
evidence of pulmonary embolism or aortic abnormality but did
reveal consolidation in nodular opacities with perihilar and
peripheral consolidation and surrounding ground glass which are
most severe in the right lower and upper lobe with additional
findings in the left lower lobe. 
 
On arrival to ___ unit, she reported that her cough and wheezing
is still profound. No sore throat, headache or night sweats. She
denies chills, rigors, abdominal pain, nausea, diarrhea, 
dysuria,
hematuria, leg swelling. No rash in her groin area but does have
multiple creams prescribed by dermatology due to various skin
rashes and GVHD. Erythema of right shin improved per patient
report - reported injury to RLE ~ 6 weeks ago that appears to
have no healed completely - no worsening erythema or
pain/discharge. Usual numbness of right toes following prior
surgery; has noted some increased sensations on the bottom of 
his
feet.  

 
Past Medical History:
TRANSPLANT DATA (PER OMR)
===================================
Transplant Date: ___
Graft: URD
Conditioning Intensity: Reduced-Intensity
Conditioning Regimen: Flu/Bu/ATG
Donor Info: ___ CMV(+), ABO: Opos
Recipient Info: CMV(+), ABO: Opos    

POST TRANSPLANT COURSE (PER OMR)
==================================== 
*D0 = ___. Had expected reactions to ATG with some fluid
overload issues and given diuresis with Lasix. Creatinine
increased slightly in this setting. No ongoing fevers. Required 
1
red cell transfusion and 2 platelet transfusions during her
admission. Has history of prior DVT's(has filter in place) and
anticoagulation was switched to Lovenox. Discharged on 
___.

*Doing well and was transitioned to home. She had periodic loose
stools, felt more related to medications and not GVHD.
 
___, presented to the emergency room with headache, 
fevers,
and vomiting and was admitted with concern for meningitis.
Treated initially with cefepime and acyclovir to cover both
bacterial meningitis and HSV meningitis. LP on ___ was
consistent with aseptic meningitis and no HSV was found in the
CSF; IV antibiotics discontinued. Extensive workup for VZV, EBV,
HSV, HHV6, adenovirus, arbovirus, TB, Anaplasma and serum
toxoplasmosis was negative. Symptoms improved over time. 

*Noted for CMV viremia and started IV ganciclovir on ___
which was transitioned to oral valganciclovir prior to 
discharge.
CMV VL has been negative since ___ and her Valganciclovir
was switched to maintenance dosing, and then discontinued
(switched back to Acyclovir).  

___ - ___, Admission with headache, nausea and vomiting
and development of fevers to 103 with coagulase-negative
gram-positive cocci in blood cultures noted as S. epidermidis
bacteremia. Headache resolved on own with MRI of head from ___
unremarkable. CMV, EBV, HSV, HHV6, adeno, ___, 
arboviruses,
Lyme, crypotococcus, and fungal markers were all negative. 
Treated with antibiotics which were narrowed to vancomycin with
noted S. epidermidis bacteremia. No other sources of infection
were noted. A TTE revealed normal biventricular cavity sizes 
with
mild global left ventricular hypokinesis, mild mitral
regurgitation with normal valve morphology and trace aortic
regurgitation with normal valve morphology. No TEE as it would
not change the course of therapy. Continued on Vancomycin until
___ and was transitioned to Daptomycin as Vancomycin 
levels
fluctuated frequently throughout her hospitalization. Complete 6
weeks of antibiotics therapy with Daptomycin until ___
with vanco locks in attempt to save her port. POC pulled on
___ and continued Daptomycin peripherally until PICC 
placed
on ___.  Daptomycin course completed on ___
as planned; PICC line removed.
  
*URI with prolonged cough in ___. + Enterovirus noted on
viral PCR testing. Symptoms slowly improved.
 
*Increased rash on face and torso; tried steroid creams.

___ - ___, admitted with diarrhea and worsening rash.
Diarrhea resolved without intervention. Started on increased
steroids with improvement in rash. Discharged on Prednisone 80 
mg
daily which is now being tapered, currently on 7.5 mg daily.

___, Rituxan for GVHD (muscle cramping) x 1 dose. Added
in CellCept to try and taper other medications.

___ - ___, Admitted with four days of productive cough,
fevers and chills consistent with community acquired pneumonia;
treated with antibiotics.

PAST ONCOLOGIC HISTORY (PER OMR)
==========================================

IIA

satiety, hypoalbuminemia and found to have mesenteric mass
- ?___ ex lap with 15 cm lobulated mass involving the
duodenum, retroperitoneum and celiac access.  Biopsies showed
Follicular lymphomas grade II/III.  Reportedly negative staging
Gallium scan. CD10+ BCL2+
- ___ completed 6 cycles CHOP, complications included
SVC/innominate thrombus (tPA)

marrow at completion was negative for lymphomatous involvement.
- ___ PET-CT with very slight amount of increased tracer
activity within the posterior left supraclavicular region. No
other areas of FDG avid disease were noted 
- ___ through ___ per records she was treated with CVP
followed by course of single agent Rituxan

recurrent disease, stable mesenteric mass.

increased conspicuity of nodular borders
- ___ PET-CT with L. hilar LN PET-avid to SUV 7.9, otherwise
stable mesenteric mass with low level SUV 2.2 stable since 
prior.
- ___ CT torso showed persistent mesenteric and left hilar
lymphadenopathy. Stable right middle lobe small focus of ground
glass opacity and adjacent subpleural fat hypertrophy, 
suggestive
of inflammatory process. Stable right adnexal cyst.  
- ___ Presented to PCP ___ ___iscomfort. 
Exam
revealed new adenopathy. Labs notable for LDH 341, WBC 10.1,
normal differential, PLT 452. 
- ___ PET CT revealed, "Large left cervical,
supraclavicular, mediastinal lymphadenopathy, and 
retroperitoneal
lymphadenopathy, and small mesenteric
lymphadenopathy, all markedly FDG-avid and concerning for
lymphoma." SUVmax 35.5.
- ___iopsy revealed diffuse large B cell
lymphoma, CD20+ CD10+ lambda restricted. MIB and cytogenetics 
are
pending

abdominal mass, SUV ___ C4 Rituximab

lymphoma
- ___ Presented with large DVTs, SVC filter placed

Hypogammaglobuonemia/CVID.
- ___, CT torso with no evidence of active disease. Stable

Ms. ___ was admitted on ___ for her MUD allogeneic

menigitis, CMV viremia, S. epidermidis bacteremia, DVT's of

She was last seen outpatient on ___. During this visit, 
she did not have any URI symptoms. She reported using her
inhalers as needed only. She noted some diarrhea and vomiting
which persisted for several days and then stopped. Overall, she
reported feeling well without sick contacts. 

Since the visit on ___, she reported that the several days 
(4
days ago), she was more fatigue, had mild sore throat, and had
exposure to sick contacts with URI symptoms. She noted increased
cough and wheezing but this improved somewhat with inhaler and 
so
she felt she was improving. However, on ___, she
started feeling unwell again. On ___, she visited a
local urgent care and was found to have a fever of 100.7. At 
this
point, she was coughing more with increased wheezing and 
fatigue.

In addition, she noticed a headache (somewhat typical of her
migraines) that wrapped around her head like a "C". The headache
started from the back of the head and progressed into the 
frontal
part of her head. She did not notice any visual disturbances,
lightheadedness, or dizziness. The headache appeared to be worse
with increased cough but was not associated with visual
disturbances, nausea, or vomiting. Her appetite has diminished
significantly - she did eat or drink adequately for almost the
past 48 hours. The provider at the urgent care advised her to
come to the ED and so she called the ___ fellow who directed her
to the ___ ED. 

In the ED, her initial vitals were: T 99-100.2, HR 104-103, BP
114-134/52-66, RR ___, SPO2 95-97% RA. Lung examination was
significant for loud audible cough, diffuse wheezing, and
crackles. Labs were remarkable for WBC 13.4, HGB 12.9, plt 229, 
Cr 1.3 and lactate 1.1. Flu negative. She was given albuterol
nebs, DuoNeb, and IVF. CXR showed RLL opacity c/f pneumonia. 
Given CXR findings, she was given cefepime IV and vancomycin IV. 

She was also noted to have increased 02 requirement (RA on
initial ED visit then became hypoxic, ___ via NC). This 
prompted
CTA CHEST  (given DVT hx) but fortunately, CT chest did not show

reveal consolidation in nodular opacities with perihilar and
peripheral consolidation and surrounding ground glass which are
most severe in the right lower and upper lobe with additional
findings in the left lower lobe. 
 
On arrival to ___ unit, she reported that her cough and wheezing
is still profound. No sore throat, headache or night sweats. She
denies chills, rigors, abdominal pain, nausea, diarrhea, 
dysuria,
hematuria, leg swelling. No rash in her groin area but does have

his
feet.

___ CT SINUS:

___ TTE:

enlarged. There is no evidence for an atrial septal defect by

mmHg. There is mild symmetric left ventricular hypertrophy with 
a normal cavity size. There is normal regional and global left

mediastinal lymph nodes. Complete resolution of the parenchymal

tissue.

versus volume averaging of adjacent vessels.  Recommend

mitral regurgitation. Mildly dilated ascending aorta.

No evidence of recurrent lymphoma in the chest. Stable small 
mediastinal lymph nodes. Complete resolution of the parenchymal 
opacity in the right lower lobe which most likely represented 
pneumonia.  Patchy opacity in the left lung base is new and 
could represent atelectasis.

1. Limited study as described.
2. Interval progression of opacification and enhancement within

otomastoiditis, with no definite evidence of intracranial 
extension.

artifact.  If not artifactual, differential considerations 
include infectious and inflammatory etiologies.

tissue.

versus volume averaging of adjacent vessels.  Recommend 
attention on follow-up imaging.

heterogeneity compared to ___ prior exam with question 
enhancement.  While finding may represent marrow expansion, 
infectious, inflammatory, and neoplastic etiologies are not 
excluded on the basis of this examination.  Recommend attention 
on follow-up imaging.

petrous 
temporal bone.  Inflammatory, infectious or neoplastic 
etiologies are not 
excluded.

ethmoid air cells and predominately in the bilateral maxillary 
sinuses, improved since the prior study.  Enhancement in the 
retromaxillary fat is difficult to evaluate due to lack of T1 
post-contrast fat saturated images.

expansion, infectious, inflammatory or neoplastic etiologies.

SUMMARY STATMENT
================
Ms. ___ is a ___ year old woman with history of follicular 
lymphoma to DLBCL treated with multiple rounds chemotherapy 
complicated by therapy-related myelodysplasia treated with 
alloHSCT with Flu/Bu/ATG RIC (D0 ___ complicated by 
graft-versus-host disease, multiple deep vein thromboses with

(___) complicated by residual cranial nerve palsy who

leukemia. Her course was notable for initiation of 
venetoclax/decitabine.

# AML
# t-MDS ___ alloHSCT
t-MDS transformed to AML with up to 83% blasts (___) in elderly
host with significant co-morbidities. G6PD normal. Patient
cytogenetics show multiple complex mutations from bone marrow
biopsy. Chimerism from cytogenetics shows a greater percentage
of XX chromosomal cells versus donor XY (~88 vs ~12%). 
Decitabine/venetoclax induction (___) every four 
weeks. Doses of chemotherapy were adjusted as the patient was 
put on different antifungals. BMB ___ with reassuring 
findings, no signs of disease. Neupogen given briefly with 
appropriate marrow response. Patient kept on acyclovir and 
atovaquone for prophylaxis. Bactrim chose over atovaquone at 
discharge.

Presented with one week of progressive sinus pressure, headache,
facial warmth. CT SINUS (___) demonstrated pan-opacification of
bilateral maxillary sinuses with circumferential mucosal
thickening, with fat stranding in the retro maxillary fat pads
concerning for invasive fungal vs bacterial sinusitis yet

swelling, right lower extremity noninvasives showed new right

complicated by therapy-related myelodysplasia treated with 
alloHSCT with Flu/Bu/ATG RIC (D0 ___ complicated by 
graft-versus-host disease, multiple deep vein thromboses with 
IVC filter in place, cavernous sinus aneurysm with coiling 
(___) complicated by residual cranial nerve palsy who 
presented to ___ with sinusitis and new acute myelogenous 
leukemia. Her course was notable for initiation of 
venetoclax/decitabine.

ACTIVE ISSUES
=============
# AML
# t-MDS ___ alloHSCT
t-MDS transformed to AML with up to 83% blasts (___) in elderly
host with significant co-morbidities. G6PD normal. Patient
cytogenetics show multiple complex mutations from bone marrow
biopsy. Chimerism from cytogenetics shows a greater percentage
of XX chromosomal cells versus donor XY (~88 vs ~12%). 
Decitabine/venetoclax induction (___) every four 
weeks. Doses of chemotherapy were adjusted as the patient was 
put on different antifungals. BMB ___ with reassuring 
findings, no signs of disease. Neupogen given briefly with 
appropriate marrow response. Patient kept on acyclovir and 
atovaquone for prophylaxis. Bactrim chose over atovaquone at 
discharge.

# Maxillary sinusitis
Presented with one week of progressive sinus pressure, headache,
facial warmth. CT SINUS (___) demonstrated pan-opacification of
bilateral maxillary sinuses with circumferential mucosal
thickening, with fat stranding in the retro maxillary fat pads
concerning for invasive fungal vs bacterial sinusitis yet
fiberoptic exam (___) not consistent with fungal sinusitis.
Aspergillius negative, but Beta glucan positive initially in
setting of neutropenia, Zosyn, ___, and continued sinus
symptoms. ENT saw pt multiple times and noted no c/f invasive
fungal sinusitis, MRI w&w/out contrast of sinus/skull base ___
with heterogeneity in left maxilla/middle ear c/f infectious
process and pt was placed on AmBisome (___). MRI results 
___ were reassuring, and switch to Cresemba from AmBisome was 
made. Due to likely drug rash vs viral exanthem described below, 
Zosyn was switched for meropenem ___. Reimaging of sinuses 
___,
looked stable from prior and ID recommended ongoing therapy with
Isavunconazole 372mg PO QD and Levofloxacin 750mg PO QD for
prolonged duration of ___ weeks pending reassessment in
outpatient ___ clinic.

(-___)

# Nonocclusive right femoral vein DVT
On ___ patient complained of unilateral right lower leg
swelling, right lower extremity noninvasives showed new right
femoral vein nonocclusive clot compared to ___ bilateral lower
extremity ultrasound. Patient has an extensive history of DVTs, 
including a DVT developing while on 10mg of Xarelto. Patient was 
given platelets and started on Lovenox half dose every 12 hours 
once plts > 30. She was discharged on Xarelto 20mg daily, which 
was her home medication before admission.

On ___ presented with suspected drug rash with Zosyn being
likely aggravating factor. ___ spreading to arms and chest.

and itching daily until ___ when patient woke up with xerotic,
blanching, non-raised rash over chest, legs, arms, and back.

suggested drug rash. Meropenem switched to levofloxacin. 
Resolution of rash within the following days. Steroid creams 
prescribed per dermatology service.

All blood cultures drawn during admission where negative ___,
